description: I had a little time to waste before my daughters graduation so I belled up to the bar and had a drink. I forgot that bars don't have video poker machines on the bar. So I had to converse with the local Gentry. Nice dive bar wish I still lived here...
author: Ira Z.

description: Awful place to have a birthday. Don't come here  Bouncer is an idiot that thinks he understands people but he doesn't.
author: Mike P.

description: Saw the bouncer picking fights.   When we got there he grabbed and forcefully shoved some girl.  Heard him aggressively yelling when we were leaving.  What is that?!
author: Dante C.

description:
Cool and mellow place for an afternoon pit stop during my dog's walk. Good selection of beers (plus liquor if you want it), friendly staff and an interesting bunch of locals rotating in and out.

Vinny (the dog) and I will return...
author: Diarmuid R.

description:
A dive in the Mission a few blocks from Mission and closer to Dolores Park.

500 Club is just a classic dive in the area. Interesting ambiance, always a chill crowd, decent enough bar tenders and strong drinks.

I wish I could write more, but because of the affordable, strong drinks I generally can't recall much of this place. But if you're in the area or near Dolores and want to forget the rest of your day, 500 Club is a solid choice.
author: Michael C.

description: The new owner is a POS. Stop giving people like this your money.
author: Rachel D.

description: As others have said, this is a great dive bar.  Super chill atmosphere, great bartenders and stiff drinks.  Added bonus they accept credit card ($20 minimum).  Definitely will be put into the regular rotation.
author: Nick G.

description:
Nice place.

Actually had people my age. 40+ ish.

Only one millennial.

Will consider as my dive bar of choice as I'm seeking a replacement...

Anonymously purchased a drink for the lady next.to me, as she appeared to need it...
author: Steven T.

description:
I first dragged a group of friends in here solely for the fabulous blinking neon sign that sits atop the 500 Club - how can you NOT love a golden champagne/martini glass that flashes throughout the night?

There's not too much to say about 500 Club, other than
- the drinks are strong and cold
- the bar feels homey yet divey at the same time
- the bartenders and bouncers are nice
- this is where you go to unwind, not impress

I'll hapily be back soon!
author: Claire S.

description: I stopped in here after a show in the Castro with a girlfriend for a drink and to visit the loo. They have a decent couple of brews on tap, plenty of seating, and the service was superb. I want come back again when I don't have a BART schedule hounding me to leave quickly and enjoy a couple drinks and people watch.
author: Cristina B.

description:
If I can give this zero stars, I would.

Completely RUDE bartenders and staff. Someone in the bar got sick (hello, it's a bar. It happens.) they completely embarrassed the poor girl and yelled at her in front of the whole bar. Lots of profanity and false accusations. The yelling got to the point where 90% of the people at the bar left. I do not support a business that belittles their customers and embarrasses them in front of a large group. Terrible, never coming here again.
author: Marcie A.

description:
The crowd and the music they select on the AMI jukebox is diverse. The drinks are heavily poured. Sunday $5 greyhounds (fresh squeezed grapefruit juice, too) are excellent value.

Great dive bar.
author: Chris C.

description: The platonic ideal of a dive bar!! Thank you Fred for always making strong drinks--love you guys
author: Perry C.

description:
Idk if I came here during happy hour or what but bottled PBRs at $2 each. SOLD. 

Total dive. Totally great.
author: Maria E.

description: Horrible place. Their photo booth doesn't work and it ended up eating $10. One picture came out, the other one didn't and the staff didn't help us out. Instead he kept trying to kick us out and said it's time to leave (it was 2am). Extremely rude staff. I told them I would give them a negative Yelp review and he said yeah you do that. So here it is. Never going back.
author: V V.

description:
This place makes the best bloody marys in the city! We have been on many a bar crawl in search of the perfect breakfast beverage and this place is always a winner. 

Now this is a dive bar in the mission that always has a good crowd of locals watching some form of sport. I'm sure the bartenders love it when we roll in with a group of 4 or 5 and order bloody marys but they aways make they and they are always great.

Depending on the bartender they either add a splash of guinness or a splash of red wine, both add a little something extra that I just love. In fact, that's how I make my own now! Thanks for the tip, 500 Club.

I was shocked that they didn't participate in the Bloody Mary festival last year, hopefully they will do so the next time around!!
author: Sarah S.

description: Worst bartending. They don't care whether their customers come back as they are in a good location.
author: Nancy86 B.

description:
Gotta love this place for a nice stiff local drink. Sometimes the drinks are a hit or miss, but hey that's the fun of it. Ask the bartender to add or take away and they're cool about it. 

It's certainly not your Valencia "hipster" vibes. Legit divey patrons here! 

The bartender offered me a half of a sand which which was pretty darn awesome half way through a damn good dirty martini. Staff is usually pretty cool. I'll definitely continue to come back.
author: Mercedes F.

description: The beer is stale. The glasses are warm. Poor bar tending. Location may be the only thing saving this place OR people who come here don't care what the beer tastes like when they drink it. (I only drank beer here). Weak sauce.
author: Erik M.

description: Hubbie and I had our first date here 21 years ago. We went back on Saturday just to pop in for nostalgic sake. Still divey, still wonderful. With the exception of the rainbow flag to "announce themselves" (21 yrs ago no one really gave a shit who you slept with, but whatever), nothing else had changed. Bought a t-shirt for prosperity. Drinks were solid and the bartender was super sweet. With the exception of the hipsters who came in and kept asking for drink samples, and their deep meaningful discussion about some stupid arse hip beverage, the place is exactly how I remember it. Great tunes and very cool clientele. Would have loved to experience the "in crowd" later in the eve, but we're too old for that nonsense. Rock on 500!
author: Claire S.

description: The staff is amazing. The vibe is so friendly. This has become my favorite bar in San Fran. Thank you Simone and Megan for making our night!
author: Chelsea H.

description: Rude staff with terrible service.  Don't waste your time or money here.  The bouncer also made rude comments and was extremely drunk on the job.
author: Kevin W.

description:
Divey bar close to Dolores park.

Walking around the area, the large neon sign has always caught my attention, and recently I've finally had the chance to visit during off-hours. It's actually quite roomy inside, with lots of seats in the bar and the couch areas. Even though it was in the middle of the day, the place was pretty packed with folks looking to get drunk! There are also multiple TVs playing different types of sports. In general, you will feel comfortable and relaxed coming here with friends or just by yourself for a quick "detox" from work stress.

Usually the place is crazy crowded at night, with crowds of people waiting outside. If you're lucky enough to catch this place during off-hours, definitely stop by and catch a quick drink!
author: Henry L.

description: Samone was the only one who made this place tolerable! She offered to remake my drink and kept apologizing for the utterly rude bartender that told me to go somewhere else for an old fashion just because I asked for more bitters in an old fashion. The customers are just as worse! A regular told me, "do you ever shut the fuck up?!" After just expressing to him that it was my friends 21st. So I hope that anyone who attends her revives service from samone, otherwise don't bother!
author: Bri M.

description:
Race discrimination???

bartender is rasist. He refused to serve a beer to my friend because of skin color. White guy came and sat next my friend and ordered beer, and the bartender served beer for him but not for my friend. My friend kept asking a beer, the bartender completely ignored my friend. 

Sucks
author: Sungmin S.

description: I like this bar because it's a little off the main strip in the Mission area and there seem to be more locals than tourists. ;) Great dive bar, good drinks, bartenders, and fun spot. And if you're LUCKY, you might run into the Tamale Lady here like we did last weekend. :))) Good crowd and vibes whenever I come here. Love the jukebox, too!
author: Jennifer J.

description: The 18th St. crew used to frequent the 500 club in the 70's when it was yer basic alcoholic bar.
author: Tom R.

description: My favorite bar in the Mission! Always have a good time when I come here. Love the local bar flies that frequent this place. Bartenders that have seen all that the Mission has to offer both good and bad, and always give a generous pour.
author: Jason S.

description: I love the red lighting! The iconic sign, the delicious casual drinks and most of all the photo booth. Great music and a nice date spot
author: Natalia G.

description:
Totally a dive bar, but I like old dive bars. Came in here around Happy Hour and they had some good deal with the beers on tap. Barely any around, but that's what was great. You could just sit around and talk with a friend over a beer. They say Cash Only, but there's another sign that's says they take cards but with a $20 minimum. Just pay cash, unless you really feel like drinking.
By the way, check out the Crying Velvet Elvis painting...my favorite.
author: Courtney F.

description: Went here for the first time the other day and had an awesome experience. The door man even saved me from some creep. Bartender was sweet, beer was cold, ambiance was cool and a nice little hole in the wall I loved it.
author: Flower F.

description:
I highly recommend going to the juke box to play "Shout" by Tears for Fears. The bartender may become so enraged that he switches the breaker to disconnect power to the jukebox and, paradoxically (given the song title), shouts at the bar patrons to never play that song again. Pure gold.

Just FYI: I'm updating my review while watching Tears for Fears perform "Shout" live. And I really think you should go to this bar and play this song.
author: Millicent G.

description:
This is a dive bar that is winning at what it does. Staff is incredibly friendly and willing to interact with you. I may dare say this was the closest I felt to being at Cheer's where everybody knows my name, and I was there for like 4 hrs once. It really was that chill. chhhiiiiiiillllllllllllllllllll

I'd recommend coming here early (you know, bar early), we had a great time and it wasn't too crowded. Drinks were good and cold. People were cool. What's not to like?
author: Lesley W.

description: Beware of the credit card minimum! We asked to combine tabs, they said "no" then took my card after we said "just put it on the original tab", then didn't warn me of the $20 minimum. When I asked why my charge was not the $13 originally stated, the not-so-friendly bartender simply pointed to the sign above her head (in the dark, cluttered, busy bar) that said "$20 minimum on credit cards" without speaking another word to me. I found it condescending and it ruined my experience! Had we had it all on our original tab, we wouldn't have had an issue! Try one of the many similar bars nearby for a better customer experience!
author: Kate G.

description:
My favorite neon sign in SF.

Also my go to for watching day baseball.
author: Nate R.

description:
Martini 
Christmas Lights
Great juke box
Friendly people
They like the warriors here, apparently
Inexpensive drinks
Lots of televisions
Tall bartender
How many letters do you need yelp review? What do you want from me?
author: Steven C.

description: Fell in love with this place it's old sku me n my fiancé will b going here every week
author: Remysbarbie M.

description: They would not let my friends in from Lebanon. They had legitimate IDs. They said they weren't welcome. Please no one give them service. They are racist. I am extremely disappointed and upset. We had to go to another bar. They are not equal.
author: Brittany S.

description:
500 club probably doesn't really care about this review. Nor the many before it. 

They probably don't care about the ripped seats in the booth. Nor the limited selection  on the old school (but golden oldies sweet jams) cd jukebox. Nor the as-it-is decor and service. 

500 Club is your neighborhood dive that does its thing and does it well - keeping regulars happy with reasonably priced beer without the extraneous "hi my name is _____, and I'll be your server tonight." This is your perennial Mission dive bar before the Mission became the mission. As a first time visitor, I respect that but also instantly know my place in line. 

Rock on 500 club, rock on.
author: Jon L.

description:
If I had not ordered a Bloody Mary ($8) here, I would have been happier. Argh misleading Yelp recommendations. This divey bar is a cool place to stumble if you're just looking for a lowkey night with good drinks. Bartenders are chill, and it gets kinda loud with the music and chatter, but hey! If you don't like it, you can just walk out.

It's not too hard to find a place to sit and hangout. This place is huge! Anyways onto the drinks, which are pretty strong here. I also know this because I sat at the bar and watched the bartenders pour liquor. My only disappointment was the Bloody Mary which tasted very sour and not much like a Bloody Mary at all. The comments and photos on Yelp did not match what I actually got.

Great place to watch sports or just hang out.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
500 club opens 9ish for those who need to drink early and often
HH M-F, till 7, well drinks (3)

long bar counter. not many drafts on tap
brew: anthem apple cider(5)
-oregon based, tasted sour more than sweet.
shoulda went fo the well drink.

on draught::
-service ok
-tv tuned to baseball not socceer.
-large space, good for groups...
author: Victor G.

description:
This is the place where people come in  groups, nah more like herds this place gets pretty busy , real busy , talk about a night to remember y'know. 

I love the jukebox here, I am pretty much a pro at it.
The writing on the walls, the art, and the decor is real cool.
I saw some funny stuff written in the bathroom.

My Pabst is always nice and chilled .
Its kind of a small venue but they make the most of it reeeeeeal good.
You could tell this place is used and abused yet still maintains its classiness.

Karaoke starts pretty early here, its very enjoyable tho.
I love the karaoke here, I am yet to get my chance to get on the mic here tho.
They gotta huuuuuge bar .
Me , I like to have this as my starting point before crawling to other bars.

I like the location of the place.

One day I was having a bad day , then I came here and things seemed great.
I even took alot of memorable photo's that night.

Some of the drinks seem to have    some random veggies in em.
They looked cool but ah I maintain my drink normalcy.
author: Luke S.

description: Loved this place! Cool dive bar. Strong drinks, and great music. Would be a regular if I lived in San Fran area.
author: Claudia E.

description:
Woo hoo! Its the Big 5-0-0!! I've officially written 500 reviews! 

What better way to celebrate, than to review the 500 Club! Took an Uber car to the spot, but it was way early for any of the shenanigans and packed crowds I had read about to even have a start. Early on, around 9:30pm on a Saturday night, the place looked more like a gay bar (filled to the brim with tons of blatantly flaming men hanging out with other men, not even batting an eye at me). The ceilings of the bar and seating areas were adorned with glowing red lights creating a scene Natural Born Killers-esque, yet without the psychotic main characters. I could see why people are drawn to the 500, it's got an edge to it, yet remains clean and fresh smelling, which are usually not traits of a dive bar. 

Standing there, having my celebratory drink, I was lectured by the fellow to my right, that this was indeed a great place for one to find a boyfriend, if you are a man! He did not like me standing there beside him, as I had just decreased the chances of some new piece of meat crossing his path. I loved the whole nature of this infamous SF spot, in spite of the unwanted vibes I was picking up from my right. 

Return Factor: %70

+TIPS+
~Cash only!
~Bring your single gay guy friends! :-)
~Don't go until at least after 10pm, maybe not even 'til 11pm or 12?!
author: Cassandra E.

description: Stopped here late afternoon on a Sunday. Jukebox was playing a good mix of hip-hop and jazz funk. Relaxed atmosphere and patrons. Donny, behind the bar, is good people.
author: Cooper B.

description:
Grade A, terrific daytime dive bar, with amazing food delivered from next door at Clare's deli. Best French Dip I've had in years. 
Drink deals Monday and Tuesday. 
GOLD STAR!
author: Amani Ellen L.

description: Stinky carpet and a great sign, sold! Used to be a better dive but cool anyway. Cheap and ready to rock, go drink until you die here.
author: Tommy W.

description:
500 club...I love you but you think I'm fancy and that I don't really fit in. I get it. I'm a martini/wine girl and you are a shot of fernet/pabst sort of spot. I love you regardless. I ordered a michelada here once and the bartender fondly referred to it as a pain-in-the-ass-beer. I get that, but I still wanted one...they are delicious. His michelada was delicious indeed so all is well. 

This is a popular true dive bar in the Mission. Regular patrons (myself included now, lol) their eyes at the drunk hipsters who spill in for a drink post Dolores Park on the weekends. You think I'm fancy with my micheladas...hah! Think again. 

Overall it's a fun spot to grab a casual drink. They have awesome daily drink specials and big booths, tvs, etc. All of the basic bar components. Sometimes I get a bit overloaded on fancy, on trend, $15 cocktails and I crave a regular vodka soda or a regular beer and I come here to seek refuge. Try it out if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Juliet S.

description:
Quality dive bar. 

When the front door guy is hammered, you know it's the kind of place where you aren't paying more than 4/drink.
author: Em L.

description: Probably my favorite dive bar in SF.  Definitely my most frequented. I love the jukebox.
author: Kamael S.

description:
This is one of those bars that is easy to forget, apparently. 

After a delicious sushi dinner, a friend suggested that we grab a drink at the 500 Club. I thought that it was my first visit here, but walking through the door, I remembered that it had been my first stop on a Halloween pub crawl last year. 

It's a typical dive: dim lighting, rock music blasting. Drinks are cheap but seemed pretty weak. I ordered two whiskey gingers, and usually one is enough to get me a little tipsy, maybe even drunk. Even after two, I wasn't feeling much of a buzz. I inherited my mother's bad driving skills AND weak alcohol tolerance. Don't worry friends, I don't drive, sober or drunk. I stay off the road as a favor to those around me. 

The bartender was nice and service was fast, but I think they really need to give the customer more bang for their buck. 

There's an old school arcade game in the back room, all the way in the corner, but don't waste your quarters. It's way broken. There is a sign saying that you play at your own risk.... how lame. Have it fixed or get rid of it, as it just takes up valuable space for one or two more guests to sit down. 

On our last visit, a somber fellow in the corner was eating Chinese food all by his lonesome. He had about five or six (nearly empty) boxes of takeout nearby. So if nothing else, there is some interesting people watching to be had here.
author: Brandi W.

description:
Fernet that flows like a river in Egypt? Check.
Giants fever even though we've been World Series champs for nearly three weeks? Check.
Stiff cocktails and Pac Man's better half? Check.

Honestly, I could do this all day. There are at least 500 "checks" I could add to the list of reasons I worship the 500 Club (and one day, perhaps I will), but for now, let these grow on you.
author: Ruggy J.

description:
I'm reviewing this as an outsider and newcomer to this place.

It's fun to come in and grab a quick late night beer here (cash only) but I always feel like I'm not cool or hip enough. If I'm wearing jeans and a t-shirt or something standard, I feel like I have a third arm. Bartender and patrons have not been the friendliest to me. I only recommend if you've been coming here every day since you turned 21. For hipsters only.
author: Sarah B.

description:
Small ("cozy") inside. Rickety chairs. Good vibes. Nice bartenders. Diverse crowd.

Cash only. Bleh.
author: Julia D.

description:
This place has a decent selection of beer and drinks. Came here after the street food festival with some friends. We took a couple of shots and drank prohibition beer. It was pretty cheap, beers were like 4-5 each. And shots about 6-7? Not too sure. 

** tip: cash only, so stop by an ATM before heading here :)
author: Stella J.

description: It smells like Vegas when you walk in. I ordered a coke and it was flat, kind of a low bar that this place didn't meet. It wasn't terribly crowded and I could hear my friends conversation so at least there's that
author: Melissa T.

description: Great bar. The drinks are cheap and it's very rarely packed. The crowd is fun and it's in a very accessible location.
author: Joey P.

description: A great old school San Francisco dive bar!  This place has TV's for sports, and punk rock karaoke after dark.  Great booths to sit in and a beautiful carved bar!  One of the fun spots in the Mission to grab a drink with a group of friends.  I'll be back!
author: Jim P.

description:
After being overwhelmed by the crowd at Elbo Room, I took my small army of friends here for some good old fashioned drinks and conversation. I was a bit bummed that the photobooth was broken but the juke box was playing a good mix and we were all able to find seats in cozy corner.

The mix of people here is great and the drinks are decent. They carry cider which is all I really need to get me through the night. Overall, I like this bar. It's exactly what you'd want in a dive. 

It's a little more tucked away in the Mission. I would definitely stop in here again.
author: Amy J.

description: About as good as a dive bar can get! Cheap drinks. 90% alcohol in the mixed ones. Friendly people and not too crowded. Definitely a win.
author: Regina L.

description: TRUE SF BAR. Great spot to grab a drink, watch a game, play your own tunes from the jukebox. Kerbi is my favorite bartender who has is always all smile and can mix a mean drink:) Go to Delores Park and stop by for a drink or just come by any day of the week. You'll feel at home.
author: TVAT T.

description:
So divey so fun
Lovely friendly bar tenders. kick ass beer specials. Great atmosphere.
Only complaint is that the bloody mary pictured on yelp looks nothing like the  one they actually serve so don't get excited.
Their bloody is tasty and well priced but it lacks an abundance of garnish and is not spicy enough for my taste.
author: Molly S.

description:
Didn't order drinks because bartender literally SCREAMED across the bar at the bouncer, weird vibes on top of it, and then berated the customers for being uncomfortable. 

Unfortunately this woman made it so we couldn't give the place as a whole a chance. Red hair horror. Beware.
author: David R.

description:
I was on a dive bar exploration expedition and visited this joint, Elixir, and Uptown since all 3 were recommended by a random website as some of the best dive bars in San Francisco (also all in the Mission). 500 Club is pretty much exactly what I'd imagine a dive bar to be with a random crowd and decently priced drinks. If you're here during drinking hours, it may be hard to find a place to sit down since there aren't that many seats.

I like the big 500 Club sign outside. It's like one of those places you always see while driving around but never come in. I dedicated one night to explore SF the way a usually does not. You can't go wrong coming here for a drink from a straight up drinking establishment.
author: Marlon T.

description: i don't like giving bad reviews in terms of stars bc this place has been cool for the past couple years i've been there but last week the post-scene redhead bartender rechecked me and my friend's ids after watching us have them checked at the door by the bouncer. she then gave us hella tude as we ordered. i got a whiskey soda and my friend got a vodka and tonic. literally both of us got tap water and alcohol. the drink was damn near undrinkable and i could see the bartender watching us out of the corner of her eye smirking. idk what her problem was but the fact she fucked us both over *intentionally* is a huge problem. we're both native san franciscans, idk what all the hate was about.
author: T G.

description:
They were 5-stars until very recently, when a shitty universal jukebox was added, and the old one was taken away. 

Now when you go in, people play Beyonce and stupid stuff. That's not the scene, yo.
author: M K.

description: Divey and cheap beers. I went the day after xmas so maybe that's why it wasn't super crowded, my group of 8 friends all got a seat at a table. It's a good place if you're looking for a quick place to stop by.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: Come here and order a beer or spirits straight up. You'll be disappointed if you order anything else. This is still a proper dive bar, but is half-full of carpetbagging, sneering, Mission hipsters at night.
author: .Alan Y.

description:
Does NOT have a photo booth anymore.

Cool dive bar though!
author: matt b.

description:
Cash only or $20 card minimum and the drinks are reasonable so that "minimum" could last a while.  The price is right, but I had an overall mixed bar experience.  One of the managers was very friendly, but the bartender was not.  He actually rolled his eyes at me when I asked to put the $10 bill on a card.  At that point, I was unaware of the $20 minimum and was not informed of the rule graciously.  

I ordered an Irish coffee and it was gross.  The same unfriendly bartender asked if I wanted whipped cream.  I said yes, yet it was not provided and I decided not to push the issue. I choked the drink down because I was cold.

I know many people like this place, but I did not have a positive experience. The stars would have been 1, but the welcoming manager and low prices saved a star.
author: Tyler B.

description:
500 is rad.  There's always a fairly hilarious mix of people, and it's a great place to catch a Giants game while eating a hot dog from neighbor Clare's.  On weekends, the bloody marys really deliver.  It gets pretty crowded and noisy at night, and it feels like Bob Seger's "Night Moves" is always playing, which is not a bad thing in my book.  

Also Olaf is the shit.
author: Niqui W.

description: Saw my friend play here.  Decent spot.  Cool location, good drinks.
author: Michael E.

description: 500 is like your x-girlfriend you keep drunk dialing. The end!
author: Michael D.

description:
Came out for drinks here with some friends, after going to Zeitgeist. It is an OK dive bar, with a really bad bathroom.

Bartenders were OK, and the beer selection was OK. I may need to come back to check out the food, the tacos on special looked like a good deal.
author: Mike H.

description:
I watched a man push a woman to the ground at this bar last night and THE BOUNCERS KICKED HER OUT, NOT HIM! WTF???? I don't care how drunk and annoying she was being, that kind of violence should not go unchecked. My boyfriend and I both told the bouncer what happened, I witnessed the whole thing, and they ignored us. 

This place is evidently COMPLETELY UNSAFE. They should probably hire a bouncer who actually has the safety and integrity of everyone in mind, rather than protecting his friends and ignoring blatant public violence against women. Needless to say, I will not be returning.
author: Natalie F.

description: Nice little dive with friendly staff in the middle of Mission! Too bad it's not open very late. The name and sign were a bit confusing, since we were looking for a night club, but ended up inside anyway. :)
author: Henri K.

description:
A couple weekends ago, a friend and I are rolling through
the mission and swing into the 500 for one.
We get our bourbon 'n gingers and
I Tell him how I have always liked this bar and 
he tells me that I didn't like it last night.
"Wait....We were here last night?"
Yeah it was hella packed.
"Shit. did we meet up with some others?"
Yeah, Ronnie rolled in and 
Denise was here also.
"Fuck me....really?"
hahaha....She has the photo's from the booth.
"Great."
*slams drink/orders another

Not that I always remember everything...
or that I even want to.
*Idontlikedenise
Yet....
when I think of the 500, 
I always get a 
smile.

post script:
My friend was fuckin' with me.
There were no pics of me and Denise.
Thank God.
author: Rossi H.

description:
I just had a shot of fernet at home and thought.....  oh shit I never wrote my review of 500 club!

Came here on a random Monday night and discovered every Monday is Fernet night.  2 or 3 dollar shots (can't remember).  Needless to say we had 4 rounds.  Fuck. yes.  

The few times I've been here I've been REALLY drunk.  This is a friendly drunk kind of place.  Don't bring your 'tude.
author: Brian G.

description: Dive bar extraordinaire, no frills. One really awesome thing this past Saturday was that they passed around some free homemade snacks as we were enjoying an afternoon drink. Strongly suggest for a beer or ten.
author: Greg F.

description:
So the old man is a Giants fan, and he heard about this place because there happened to be a commercial for it on ESPN - really? Yes.

And, yes they do have a pretty cool SF Giants Bonds shirt, because juice or not, he is in the 500 club.

This place is pretty cool, and not as annoyingly hipsterish as Zeitgeist, and the lot.  

What I love most about this place is their menu. I felt like the little snot-nosed, trashy kid that I was/am, oohing and ahhing over the "You Know, Just for Kids" portion of the menu and the Broke Boy (yes, my childhood fav sand. was fried bologna on Rainbo or Wonder white bread)  - always 3 bucks!
author: Kara B.

description:
Ripped off? 

The too cool for school bartender chick over charged me for a few drinks. How is it possible that my friend and I ordered the same rounds and I ended up paying a buck more for each drink?  

Thanks, but I won't be back.
author: Kitty K.

description: I like this place. I live in the Mission and my best friend lives in the Castro, so I walk home a lot with my dog and end up here halfway home usually for a pee break and a beer. It's super dog friendly, which is great because my dog is almost my constant companion. Tonight I dropped in like usual, around 11 pm, booked it to the ladies room and then headed out with my small leashed dog to order a beer. Now, when you're at a bar with your dog and you see other people at the bar with their dog, especially here in the city you assume the dog is nice, and the dog owners are smart enough to know if their dog can handle this type of social situation. This guy had his bull terrier in a choke chain and when I rounded the bar his dog firmly clamped its massive jaw onto my dogs neck. And held on. We both fell to the ground trying to loosen this dogs grip from my dog for what seemed like five minutes straight. The entire ordeal was stressful and bloody. In the end it was the dog owners blood and he started immediately making excuses. I just wanted his information. I was shaken up and adrenaline rushed and I treated it like a car accident. The guy's friend even had the nerve to step in and berate me for overreacting. The dog owner kept shoving his bloody hand in my face like it was my fault, and look at how he was hurt. He said things like "my dog would be dead if it wasn't for me. " Fine! How is that my dog's fault?! My dog is seemingly fine for now, thankfully. Can you believe I left the bar and they stayed and drank more? The bartenders watched me leave, and watched other people with dogs leave because they feared their own dogs safety. The guy with his fucked up aggressive ass dog were not asked to leave? Nope, no one cared and the shitty dog owner with his dog got to stay. It's not the dog's fault. Not the bars fault, but someone should have asked him to leave. Leave your aggressive and dangerous dogs at home to avoid these situations, they are scary and fucking uncomfortable. By the way, as I type this my hands are all fucking bloody too, you piece of shit dog owner.
author: Vanessa B.

description: Typical dive bar nothing out of the ordinary.  Worth stopping in.
author: MJ A.

description:
500 Club is one of the very first (if not *the first) bar I visited in the Mission 8 years ago and I was pleased to see that it hasn't changed much, if at all. 

A bunch of us newbies were doing an amended "bar crawl" the other night and were wondering where to go after getting halfway to sloshed at Elbo Room, when we spied the Vegas-style lit up giant martini glass marquee beckoning to us from where we stood on Valencia. 

"Now *there's* a sign, perhaps from god," I thought to myself as we made our way. Upon entering I had this feeling of deja vu (very common feeling for me when I enter a bar, truth be told) but then I realized I *had* in fact enjoyed a drink right before last call all those years ago. 

This night was a good one. I even made friends with the dude on the next stool. I like when a bar doesn't have a ton of guys on the make (I am thinking back to my nights spent at the Burgundy Room in LA). I just want to talk to you, not wake up next to you, man! Why do guys in bars think that way? Why am I pondering such a stupid question? Barkeep, I need a drink.

Speaking of, the 'tenders are no-nonsense, fast, and pour 'em strong. That's really all you need on a Wednesday night. I jest. That's really all you need...well, that and decent tunes coming from the juke, and 500 Club has that, too.
author: Joi B.

description: I've been here twice now with friends just for the Bloody Mary's. It has a dive bar-like atmosphere and I'm not sure how any of the other drinks or food are. If you're in the area, it's worth a stop for the Bloody Mary.
author: Stephen B.

description:
I finally remember visiting here.
My initial introduction was a  green beer induced haze.
I'm a fan of the seating arrangements and the sleazy sounding name.
However, the bathroom is virtually rusted over and it took sheer will power
not vomit from the sight of soggy toilet paper acquired beneath the sink drain.
author: Hannah A.

description: I'm going to give this place five stars. But only because their bloody Mary's are absolutely spectacular. The bartenders are nice enough as well and they let dogs in the bar which is awesome. My boyfriend chris and I will definitely be returning to those neighborhood favorite that hasn't gotten invited by the tech crowd
author: Jami K.

description:
I have a more-love-than-hate relationship with this bar. It's almost always busy sometimes too busy. The drinks are cheap but sometimes not great. Last night had a pretty hairy gin and tonic followed by a pretty watery one, both from the same bartender. 

The space has a lodge feel to it. When it's cold I like to sit on the hearth and warm my ass and liver simultaneously. Yeah!
author: Pete F.

description: This place looks scary and dark from the outside but it was actually bright and airy on a midday sunny Saturday. The vibe was chill, the clientele mixed. The drinks were strong but I was a little disappointed in my bacon bloody mary. The condiments were good, the drink was strong but the bloody mary flavor wasn't as amazing as I'd hope it would be. The bartender was also really distracted with events on her iPhone BUT still I had a good time drinking a few rounds. I'd def return just because of the calm vibe and strong drinks.
author: Kiristen R.

description:
HAIKU REVIEW

Fantastic dive bar.
That old signage beckons me.
Average bar-tending.

After a park date,
Pull her into photo booth.
Get drunk and make out.

Hipsters galore here.
Other times, it's sporty spice.
Mostly folks are nice.

Weekends are weaker:
Karaokers' awful wails.
Avoid Sunday nights.
author: Joe J.

description: This is such a great dive bar. Cozy rounded booths that you can tuck into. Locale is friendly and so is staff. Juke box is killer!
author: Michelle B.

description:
went here again maybe my tastes have changed

heard they had a bomb bloody mary with peppercinis for a fiver but got there and it was $7 and mostly v8 with some well vodka, a couple beans & an asparagus. Meh.
author: Matt N.

description:
What to say - it sucked ...the whole "we are in the mission so we can ignore you and you still come here" attitude its just plain stupid - I don't go where my business is not appreciated .So ta-ta 500 Club ;-)
(one star b/c Yelp want allow less)
author: Dupa B.

description: Great dive bar. Strong cheeps on the cheap. Back room. Bathroom is disgusting. Nothing to write home about but close to Dolores Park when you don't want to drive anywhere
author: Sigorney S.

description:
500 Club used to get 5 stars from me, but in the past year or so I'd have to drop one due to the change of music (I can't find anything on that jukebox I'd want to listen to these days), and the people who seemed to have migrated from "the marina"

Other than that....can't beat the dive bar feel...and the best bartender around on friday and saturday nights --Donny!   He mixes a mean cocktail which will kick your ass by surprise.

I miss the regulars whose pictures used to paper the back wall...and the pool table.  But I still can't find a better place to just hang out with friends, learn what the heck Austrailan rules football is, has a photobooth, pay reasonable prices....just make sure if you're drivin over there to allow time to find parking!
author: Q L.

description:
I've been waiting to review this place until after the New Year started because I didn't want to give away my little secret. This is my favorite spot to spend New Years Eve. 

This is a decent back up bar most of the year. Divey enough for those militant about drinking in a down scale establishment but not so divey as to scare off the squeamish. You can't argue with two-dollar pints of Shiner Bock during happy hour.

For NYE you can spend a small fortune getting into a club and spend another small fortune on over priced drinks at a fancy party, or you can get here early to snag a booth and sit in the best people watching spot in town.

If I see you all here next NYE and you're hogging all the booths I'm going to be pissed!

***** Just a reminder! This is a cash only establishment!
author: Manny F.

description:
It's probably silly to review a place based on very little...but it's a dive.  An honest to goodness dive, unlike some of which strive to be a dive (hey, that rhymed) but in actuality are the epitome of trying to hard (TTH) which basically describes my life right now.

Moving on...

The layout of this place makes it difficult to navigate, but it could have just been the fact that it was getting late, my body was begging for bedtime, and I had a blister forming on my foot due to my super cute shoes.  

The bartenders can sling them just as well as the best, and I think the price was reasonable.  Actually, I have no idea who paid for my drink.  It might have been me.

Although others have intimate knowledge of the photobooths in the city, I was a photobooth virgin up until now (in SF, anyway).  I guess $5 is reasonable for two copies of 4 pics...my copy is proudly displayed on my refrigerator so I can be reminded of how much fun I usually have.  My cats also now have someone to blame if I stay out too late.

Why only 3 stars?  50 cents a pop to play the atari game.  While I spent many a day wrenching my joystick (not in THAT way) trying to get the yellow man around the maze or that stupid frog to the other side (why does he need to go there, anyway)...but now I pretty much suck.  If it was SMB, it may be different, but my Atari skillz are now in the gutter.  As I still like to play, I would be much more inclined to pay only a quarter to lose all 3 lives in 5 minutes rather than 50 cents.  What can I say?  Quarters are a precious commodity when it is laundry day.

I'll probably be back eventually...with a whole bunch of quarters.  And I'll of course be practicing in the mirror for my next photoshoot.
author: Pam S.

description: The 500 Club was ok.  It was freezing in there as they had both doors open wide the whole time we were there.  It is pretty loud in there, but I could still hear a lot of the conversation, which was better than most bars.
author: Eric H.

description:
Fantabulous Dive Bar in the Mission!!
I've been to 500 several times, and just recently helped celebrate a friend's birthday here. Stoked that we managed to snag a booth.

Cheap beer (on tap and draft) and such a cool vibe. Bartenders are super friendly and nice. As the evening progressed, the crowd got larger and I suspected a long wait as my friend went to the bar to order another round of beer. One of the guy bartenders made immediate eye contact with her (how that happened is beyond me as she was behind a bunch of dudes), and she indicated the beer and within minutes she was back at the booth with them. HOLLAH, that's how she rolls! Maybe the bartender was sweet on my friend, and hopefully the dudes weren't pissed off that she got served before they did. We didn't care as we were happy drinking our very ice cold beer (BTW, the beer fridge must below the usual refrigerating temp, as we needed a napkin to hold the bottles as they were icy cold)!

Love the fireplace towards the back of the bar, and wonder if it's ever used. There's another door, which is actually the fire exit door, but smokers and non use to enter/exit. For a dive bar, I wasn't expecting the hi-def tvs,  Bathrooms are tiny, and one staller for the gals. 
Nice, diverse crowd of bar patrons of mainly locals.
Seems to be packed during early and later on in the evenings.
Cash only, but there's an ATM inside by the front door.

I'll be back to 500!
author: Gill C.

description:
Urban Dictionary: Dive Bar (noun): Where cheap and strong drinks are served. Refer to 500 Club. 

If restroom was visited, refer to Hepatitis A Virus (HAV) on p. 536.
author: Kenny L.

description:
THE 500 CLUB FOR 500 YELP REVIEWS !!

On the self-important occasion of my 500th Yelp review, where else would I go but the 500 Club? Just think...Yelp has a club exclusively for special people like me who have gone through the blood, sweat and tears of eking out the sometimes useful, sporadically funny and unintentionally cool write-ups that are the lifeblood of this site. This calls for my glitter tuxedo and my Rip Taylor bag of confetti.

Gee, imagine my surprise this evening when I was NOT greeted at the door with an a capella chorus of the Yelp anthem by their oh-so-youthful staff...

"Yelp, I need somebody,
Yelp, not just anybody,
Yelp, you know I need someone, YELP!"

I was expecting trumpets. I was expecting half-naked guards with really big fans. I was expecting to be taken to the private lounge where someone would peel me a grape while someone else played the lyre. Instead, this is a hipster bar in the guise of a moose lodge ...kinda like the place Ralph Kramden and Ed Norton used to go to with their beaver hats on "The Honeymooners". It has that back-bacon thrift store vibe with lots of souvenir paraphernalia behind the bar. Bummer.

But the drinks are pretty cheap. Beers are $3 at happy hour, and my Maker's Mark and ginger was only $5. And you can sure fill up on a tumbler of Chex Mix and pretzel sticks. This ain't the W, that's for sure. But where was Nish? Where were the paparazzi? Where were the bodyguards protecting me from the non-Elites? And what about my "fans"...all those little people whose names escape me for the moment? Why, no one asked for my autograph. No one wanted me to throw my confetti. Is this the luxuriant 500 Club I dreamed of entering since I started Yelping? ...Hmmm, did I mention the beers are only $3?

"Yelp me if you can, I'm feeling down
And I do appreciate you being round.
Yelp me, get my feet back on the ground,
Won't you please, please yelp me, yelp me, yelp me, oh..."

DRINKS - 3 stars...oh, and did I mention beers are $3?
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...where are the eunuchs?...bring me the eunuchs! ...gosh, the bar at the Wag Hotel is a lot nicer, and that's for dogs
SERVICE - 3 stars...gee, no fanfare for this 500 RBI Yelper...ok, she did bring me my drink pretty quick
TOTAL - 3 stars...solid dive bar...but this is what I get for writing 500 reviews?
author: Ed U.

description: If you are looking for a dive bar with locals and stiff drinks, you've found your spot. The Bloody Mary's are strong and spicy - they really do it up right. If all the drinks are like this then I am confident that anything you order will be great!  Bartenders are fast, courteous, and professional.
author: Veronica J.

description:
On like Donkey Kong.

I shuffled up 6th street and jumped over a chick doing yoga in the middle of the sidewalk.  Thought about grabbing one of the pairs of shoes (lined up with a hand written "FREE" sign on them) but decided I probably wouldn't need them to smash anything.

I waited for the cars to pass before climbing up the crosswalk to Guerrero St.  I had succesfully reached the top of the platforms but saw no damsel in distress, nor Kong of the Donkey.  Why IS he called Donkey Kong when he is clearly a gorilla?

In like Dig Dug.

I dug through the first layer of dirt, avoided a few Pookas and ghostly eyes lingering and finally settled in the back near familiar faces.  I was sweating.  It was a chilly October evening but you wouldn't know it in this place.  A couple of hottie Fygars were working the bar and my friend asked what I wanted.  "I want a rum & coke..and just a coke."  He repeated it back.  Yes.  I handed him a $10.  He repeated my order to her and added a beer for himself. The Fygar demanded ID's. This Dig Dug is 33, I guess all that tunneling hasn't aged me as much as I thought.  The total tab for all 3 drinks was $6.  The "rum & coke" was so strong that it burned my eyes.  We wondered later if the Fygar had mistaken my order for a coke and a rum.  Either way, it was a generous pour and pretty much took care of me for the night.

We tunneled our way back through the crowd and squeezed into one of the few spots left to sit.  I perched myself on the photobooth's ledge and stared at the table top video game rotating between 4 classic arcade games.  They were cool with a friend bringing in her little pup. We somehow squeezed all of us into that teensy photobooth, dog, shoes and all.

Out like Frogger.  

I used the restroom once and was nearly splattered by someone crashing into the door upon entry. Luckily, I hopped through just in time. The thing swings and if someone is drunk and really has to pee - watch out!

By this time there was a male bartender. One of the drinks that I mix at home was brought up in conversation.  He didn't know what it was but eagerly mixed it upon our spouting out the recipe. At $4, it was the cheapest suffering bastard I've ever heard of.

The place had also cleared out a bit.  I found myself sitting temporarily on a stool discussing graphics, technology, creativity, greed and gaming.  I got completely caught up in the conversation. We all suddenly realized that we had been lingering on the logs a bit too long.

My husband's "boys night out" had ended really early - we hung out for a bit and then hopped our way back over to Bart.

I like this place.
author: Jenn N.

description:
I really like the 500 Club even with its faults.  I'm pretty sure the bartender gave me a beer with puke on it, the bathroom is disgusting and when I asked my friend who put on these ridiculous fake Ray Bans with gold trim, "Who do you think you are a f*cking hipster?!" I got mean looks but hey, isn't that what hipsters do. They give mean or bored looks, no biggie.  

Last Saturday was no different.  There was some sort of party where they kept ordering 20 beers and shots at a time.  No lie, I saw them all set up on a table.  It was actually nice when the bartender said, I'm tired of whatever game you guys are playing, NO MORE!  The party also plugged in their very own boom box even though 500 has a jukebox with a very good music selection.  (Don't ask me, I was just a voyeur.)

Even with all that I will still go back.   I like the lay out, I like the dark corners and I like the other clientele.
author: Kristin Marie S.

description: I was here with a friend on a Sunday night. It was very cozy and the lighting inside was just right, not too dark and not too bright. Wow that rhymed! It kind of sounded like it could be a fragment from 'Twas the Night Before Christmas. How cool! Ok guys remember sometimes it's the little things. Anyway, the bartenders were quick and the drinks were cheap and strong, which pretty much was reason enough for a four star rating in itself. But, what really made this place a home run was the fact that they have karaoke there. Didn't get to bust out my singing chops that night, which believe me if I didn't have work the next day I would have been all over that mic like white on rice. But I definitely plan to come back, consume more drinks whilst channeling my inner Adele. That is a promise people!
author: Riza E.

description:
Michelle S. rolled back into town this week after four months away from the Bay Area, and she chose 500 Club as the place for her big rendezvous with some of her favorite people (me, of course). It's pretty close to BART, as long as you don't walk in the wrong direction on the way there. Not that I would know ...

I love love loved the giant neon pink martini glass on the sign outside. I want one. In fact, if that one goes missing ... don't call me. I don't have it lighting up a party in my basement. I swear. Anyway, how can a place be bad after you start with that?

And next on the list, my favorite Elvis song ("Suspicious Minds") started playing on the jukebox after we walked in. More brownie points.

They had a decent selection of beers on tap considering it's a small dive bar. I had an Anchor Steam and then a pear cider (I make no apologies for my love of pear cider!). Prices were good and tolerable too. It was a pretty laid back vibe overall. The bartender was really easy to get his attention and was very nice about getting water (even offered a lemon), too. There was some obnoxious chick who stepped on my foot and stood there for too long AND splashed some of my beer on me AND didn't apologize. But, hey, it happens. 

Worst thing = bathrooms. Definitely tried to touch as little as possible in there. I've seen worse, but this was no picnic.
author: Lea B.

description:
I feel as though I spent most of my time in SF settling in only to head to a different neighborhood. We ended up at 500 Club after enjoying a drink at Harvey's (that's Castro to Mission? It's all a jumble at this point).

My what a difference a cab ride makes. I found this place to be a pretty generic dive - though I was happy to have a place to sit with three others in one of their few larges booths on a Friday night. The bar seemed hopping all night, and bartenders were quick. But other than that, I can't say I would go out of my way to go back.
author: Lauren V.

description:
One of those places that always makes me want to run to the ATM machine to withdraw cash. 

Always a good time, and who can't love a place with fabulous red carpet and interactive attractions like a photo booth and donkey pinning?
author: Alita M.

description: I only go to the 500 Club a few times a year - and each time I go there I wonder why I do not go more often.  It is a dark bar that is surprisingly comfortable and friendly and filled with hipsters, locals, and random dive bar characters.  The staff is efficient and generally smiling.  The first time I went there was in the middle of a gorgeous day when we were telling the bartender that we had to leave to grab ice to meet folks at Dolores Park - and she said "one minute" ran to the back, grabbed a clean garbage bag, filled it with ice, and then informed us that we now had time to have one more drink at the bar.  And we did.
author: Tia B.

description:
This is my favorite dive bar in the city because it was near my house (makes stumbling home so much easier). It ALWAYS smells in here but it is a dive so you can't expect The Fairmont lounge here. Drinks are cheap, the bartenders are ALWAYS busy so being personable is not an option (but they aren't rude either). 

**To the women: This place can be kind of meat marketish so be forewarned. You do get your share of slimy, drunk guys trying to get down your pants. So don't come here if you want to be alone with your thoughts & want to drink a drink in peace. Come here with your friends for a good time, laugh at the guys trying to pick you up, who cares about hipsters anyways & don't get offended.
author: Ashlee F.

description:
One of my favorite dive bars in the city.

Strong drinks, good beer selection, dog friendly, AND Kareoke on Sundays! 

I'm suuuper cereal.

This funny smell people speak of I have not encountered and is nothing compared to the sour smell at Lucky 13. 

Bartenders are friendly.

500 Club is the place to be on Sunday, fo' sho'.
author: Elle B.

description:
Yesterday was one of those great experiences that is hard to put into words. The hubby and I only shared one beer but during that time we saw so many great sites and overheard so many great conversations, it reminded me of that time we were in a dive bar in Colorado at the Livery and it seemed like Freebird played for days.

Let's just say that there was air guitar, Neo visiting from the Matrix, and some yelling from the back part of the bar to the front part of the bar about creeps and birthdays. All in all a fabulous visit!
author: Tracy A.

description:
500 Club is your favorite gritty, neighborhood, awesome staff and patron kind of place. Even with the doors open it is the right mix of low light and low lifes that make you want to keep coming back. Awesome beer specials and $6 bloody's on the weekend. Our bartender mixed up a phenomenal bloody and he includes a special ingredient that if the first one hadn't left me buzzed I'd waste away an entire Sunday enjoying. 

For $5 you can also get your photo booth fix and they give you two copies of the pics!

This dive is something special to be sure.
author: Kathleen R.

description:
I go here a lot. A lot a lot.  You just can't help it.

I love dive bars.  I collect them like dirty little puppies.  This place has inadvertently brought be tons of happiness.  

First: It introduced me to the Sweet Tea Vodka.  This is sweet tea flavored vodka with soda water... so yummy.  

Second: The Mexican Stand-Off.  This is a shot of tequila, a shot of hot tomato sauce, and a shot of Tecate.  So gross and good at the same time.

I also love the multiple TV's for sports watching, the ever loving door man, and the fact that there is Mrs. PacMan in the back.

The prices change with which bartender you have, some drinks are in a larger glass for $3.00, then 10 minutes later are $5.00 in a small glass.  Also, there can be some pretty smelly characters here, but also a few cute ones too, when there's a good crowd on the weekends.

All in all a pretty good place for a drink.
author: Meara G.

description:
Just like everyone else, I've been coming here for years for mid-Sunday chillaxing, after work happy hour, and late night socializing.  Never had a problem with bartenders (they're all super friendly - no attitude!) And I've never had a problem with the people (cool, sexy, and employed!)

This place should be a staple in your Mission diet :)
author: Heather B.

description: You always judge a dive bar, not by the way they treat their wonderfully weird regulars, but how the cool ass bartenders treat new customers who they may or may not ever see again. Rawk!
author: Jim Z.

description:
Great selection of beers, and the prices are decent. 
Gotta give mad props to the doorman too because he's very nice, and I can't say that about 99% of doormen in SF.
Crowd watching here is awesome too....you'll get a mix of a Zeus look-alike (no joke), to a butch 50's pinup-type woman with tattoos, groping unsuspecting guys by the bar.
It's a great little dive bar to watch baseball games at!
author: Alyssa G.

description: Came here for New Year's Eve and it was a great, chill environment, even on NYE. Definitely one of the cheapest dive bars in the city, and a good place to hang out for a low-key night. Great bar to go with a bunch of friends to just hang out and enjoy some drinks. I'm definitely planning to come back!
author: Kaysee T.

description:
This might jinx everything, so I'm knocking on wood with one hand as I type this review with the other. I met my boyfriend--and one of my favorite people in the world--one night at 500 Club three years ago. It was a crowded Saturday night and I was with two of my best friends. We spotted each other on opposite ends of the bar. We were both wearing bowler hats and as I was exiting the bathroom, he grabbed my arm and started talking to me. I will never forget that night! 

Actually, I've met a lot of people I still am close with to this day at 500 Club. 500 Club is badass, just avoid this place on weekend nights, because it's since been infiltrated by weirdos.
author: Laura M.

description: This place has karaoke on Sundays pretty early (5pm to 9pm). KJ Glenny Kravitz holds it down especially since the karaoke space is a bit small but it's work-able. Good drink specials and service at the bar is great. Close to 16th St. BART so it's easy to stumble to the station afterwards. Cash only.
author: Elsie M.

description:
Decently poured drinks and friendly bartenders.  This is the bar you want to go to if you want to lose the smell of Hipster Utopia aka Delores Park on a sunny day.

There is a sports bar thing going on here also, so be forewarned...
author: Sam A.

description:
When I stepped into the 500 Club I wuz ready for action and feeling like man hellbent for satisfaction.
WHAT is action?
WHAT is satisfaction?
Those were the questions that sat me at the bar stool line up and kept me planted there until i got up and stumbled into the wall as I tried to make it to the bathroom for a release of a majestic golden torrent.
I do some good thinking in the bathroom and this place's though gnarly was inspiring as I realized I needed to not only ever clean bathrooms for a living, I needed to get out of the bar and rethink some crucial issues regarding how I spend my time and who i spend it with.
DOES this mean it's time for a wife and kids?
DOES this mean it's time to start going hikes and climbing?
WHAT did I have to go into the 500 Club for?
Maybe If I had just played pool or hung out in the photo booth making strangers take their picture with me I would be in better shape.
author: Alexander R.

description:
Love it. I like checking out where the locals hang.. A friend took me here as this is his bar.

Unpretentious and a hungover barman to boot, what can go wrong?

You ask for a jack & coke, you get a glass of jack with a splash of coke.. now that's my kind of drink.

I love it. I'll be back. And the place next door will deliver your food to your bar still, which is even cooler.
author: Gina I.

description:
I don't know if you got this from the other reviews... but this is definitely a dive bar.  You can't miss the huge neon sign though :)

The atmosphere is really cool... bar and booth seats, and clever menu options.  I haven't tried them, but love the idea of ordering a 'TV dinner.'
author: Cara M.

description:
MeetUp is still a black box to me. I belong to all of two groups and I only just last night showed up for something. Was it for the Bay Area Biotech professionals? Nope. Not that one. It was for the Mission Divers group organized by Tom R. When my college buddies and I were lost with what to do for the often overhyped and always underwhelming New Years Eve, Tom and his Mission divers came to our rescue and it was actually one of the best New Years I've ever had. 

The neon pink martini glass showed lots of promise. When it took all of $30 to buy an entire six drinks, I finally knew what love was. The vibe was so great that even girls were buying me drinks! I mean, I don't swing that way...but who am I to turn down free drinks, right? To top it all off, I heard both Metallica and Neil Diamond in the same night. These rose-colored glasses just aren't coming off any time soon. 

Those cheap drinks were nothing to snuff at either. We all needed PediaLyte pops this morning. At least I didn't pee on my own shoes like my friend did. I also apologize to the bald guy on the BART train home who my friend kept trying to set me up with. I mean, I knew she kept screaming across the train to you, "My friend is #@$%ing hot!" but I was very embarassed. 

Wait, they opened at 6 am this morning....hmm....
author: Zulu Q.

description:
STRONG DRINKS.

The 500 Club is awesome. Went here on Halloween and it wasn't packed to the brim with crazy people. It's the quintessential Mission bar. It's divey, but not dirty. There's a photo booth in the back, plenty of room to sit and it's great for big groups as well. Will definitely be back to check out other nights.
author: Lauren F.

description:
One of my best friends lived around the corner from the 500 Club for three years, and never once did I step foot into there...  Until last week.  I'm sure I missed out on many good times that could have been had there...

Richard T. is right on - the big bulb, Vegas-style sign is like a beacon on Guerrero Street.  It's true the 500 Club is a dive bar, but it's not just a dive bar.  $5 infused vodka on Monday nights!  No, this isn't some fancy infused vodka...it's your standard Stoli Raspberry and the like.  It's a perfect place to come with your friends and chill out.  Drinks are cheap, so you can stay hang out all night...
author: Wendy L.

description:
I love that your dog can sit at the bar.  You can run into authentic 80s New York dive types that you would see in movies like Crocodile Dundee and not just hipsters dressed that way too be ironic (though there are a few).  One of the bartenders is mean, and not in a fun, grouchy way, but in an annoying "I'm too cool and I have the power" way, but she doesn't work there that often and the main lady is one of the nicest people I've ever met.  

Secretly I like to go here in the morning and clear my head...Giants games, any sport really is fun to watch there...whatever it's an established establishment.
author: Jack M.

description: A very mixed, low-key, neighborhood bar! Very small inside, but then again, what bar in this area isn't? Cheap beers is the selling point here! Bar tenders could be more attentive and the red lighting inside feels like I'm in. some brothel.
author: Roland T.

description: Started coming here only recently.  Great bloody mary's, especially if you can get all the veggies+bacon.  Cool interior and seating.  Pricewise it's really hard to beat.  Landed here with some friends who were visiting one day and have been back regularly ever since!!
author: Sin F.

description:
So, I get it. This bar is definitely one of the less trashier bars of the mission. Suave decorations adorn the walls, and I found myself jealous that I was not in the possession of a Lucky Strike wall clock.

Needless to say, the bartenders are quick, but I grew bored with the crowd. There was a nice clamor, but it soon became clear to me that I was knee deep in a sea of assholes.  Of course, not everyone was sporting the "I'm a cliche" attitude but I was wearing thin.

I decided to head to a more gritty bar so as to best absorb Mission Street in it's natural element.

Overall, the 500 Club has got a nice warm fuzzy feeling to it, (or maybe that was just the drinks in me) and I would definitely go back on a less crowded night.
author: Samantha P.

description:
5 stars for Glenny Kravitz and Karaoke on Sunday nights. 5 stars for nice bartenders who will pay attention to you and give you cheap beer in a timely manner. 5 stars for a mostly-straight-boy population (go early if you like your strange men soberish) who will flirt with you (me) endlessly, serenade you (me) time and again, and make you (me) feel like the supermodel special snowflake you (I) like to fancy your(my)self. 

Warning: this is a REAL, 100% beer-sloshing, alcohol-on-the-floor, drunk girls yelling at each other kind of dive bar. Don't let the comfy booths and few-and-far-between clean and floral-scented girls (Heidi and moi) fool you. People come here to get drunk. And drunk they get (self not included). So wear your best wipe-clean shoes with good traction and try not to slip and fall on your (my) ass in the wake of someone else's sloppy drinking. 

Did I mention this place rocks?
author: Autumn K.

description: Always a must.. I cant seem to pass this place without calling in.. great place.. total rock and roll.
author: Valentino B.

description:
Konichiwa fellow yelpers. What you know about the 500?

The spot drops it like its hot and keeps it real at all times and is certainly not open at 6am, just as advertised.

Housing the finest jukebox west of the mississippi, the 5-hunny certainly cannot be ignored. I went the other night with a single goal in mind: to learn how to dougie. Now let me tell you, even though the objective was not met, the 500 did not fail to provide an abundance of glory. An endless supply of SoCo/IPA hybrids provided ample sustenance for an evening of pure victory. 

My new year's resolution is to start a "*500* fan club", feel free to join me there nightly. Best. Bar. Ever.
author: klobberingthegame i.

description:
Hipsters?  Check.
Cheap drinks? Check.
God-awful decor?  Check.

Yep, I'm in the Mission again.

I cannot comment on the rest of the week, but hot damn, Glenny Kravitz's karaoke extravaganzas here on Sundays are near perfect.  It's not too crowded, you'll get to sing multiple times, and you'll have a hell of a lot of fun doing it.  Trust me.  

And when Glenny has closed up shop, don't despair.  Walk your drunk ass over to Dalva (it'll sober you up slightly), and get your karaoke on with KJ Paul, starting at 9:30-ish.
author: Suzanne C.

description:
Let's say you walk in and turn to your left and follow the wall past the bar and to the corner. You might be tempted to sit at the table in said corner, but beware. It's a wobbly table, as wobbly as they get. Maybe you're into that, maybe you're not. At the very least, now you know.

Also, there are hipsters. This is the hipster South Pole and they are today's Shackletons. (Reading a bit about his life & times now out of curiosity, I see that you can take that analogy somewhat further than I expected.)
author: Peter B.

description:
Hey Trashbag!
The sun is shining, the dogs are pooping, the bikes get stolen, The Hipsters find their way to Dolores Park The Cecilia has a 5$ Bloody at 500 club and it's pretty damn good, the evenings here can be overcrowded with Dickheads and I am probably one of them.
author: cecilia k.

description:
The sepia-tone headshot of Burt Reynolds alone is worth the price of admission (which is free). The come-hither stare, the sultry 'stache; it's Smokey & The Bandit-era Burt at the height of his powers.

They also have a photo booth (not the kind that gives a thin strip of B&W photos, but rather a single color Polaroid divided into quadrants), some pinball and horseshoe-shaped leather booths with big tables.

Come for the Burt, stay for the stiff drinks. That's what she said.
author: Trav W.

description:
Came day drinking here and LOVED the incredibly spicy and delicious bloody mary that I had.  I don't even think it was too expensive and they were really big and strong.  

This place is the definition of a dive bar & the scene (even though I was there on a slower day) was pretty cool.  I will definitely come back to this place soon.
author: sara s.

description: Not a ton of TVs for Sunday sports but the bartenders are friendly and make a great bloody mary and had a good selection of liquors and beers.  Awesome crowd and a great vibe.
author: Cody P.

description: I ended up here as another result of walking into the next bar that could be found. Upon entering someone in the group said "This must be where dive bars are made". Sure enough we sat at booth under about 5 different picture frames of Best Dive Bar in San Francisco/Best Dive Bar Ever and so on. Turning to the bar our eyes sighted $2 beers, a Spiderman comic above the bar, and some dogs wandering about. We decided to stay. For some entertainment we enjoyed the bartender yelling "Vetoed!" to a handfull of jukebox selections. Although we may have been slightly out of place due to our lack of tattoos and not being in a band we thought about staying as long as possible. Check it out.
author: Michael C.

description:
The 500 club is an oasis of awesome in the Mission. Not that the mission sucks or anything, but not all bars there are awesome. The 500 Club is!

Many a summer Saturday afternoon has been spent here, talking to Rachel, one of the many amazing bartenders at the 500, and having some of the best drinks I've had anywhere. Their epic Bloody Marys (complete with bacon, V8 spicy, and about 10 vegetables) are the stuff of legend. The margaritas are poured to perfection. There's always a fun time to be had, and the taco place is just a block away.

Oh, and as for the physical plant of said bar - it's a perfect dive bar in that it is a dive bar, but it's one of the nicest authentic ones I've been in. I've never had a bad time here, and every time I bring a new person here, they're a convert. And you are a mere block from the 22. Epic WIN.
author: Greg D.

description:
Sucks. 

They over charged me for 2 drinks last night. How come my friend bought 3 Irish Car Bombs and a Tecate and paid $25 but I bought 2 Irish Car Bombs and paid $18. Oh and this was 12:00am so he didn't catch the happy hour. I was full on ripped off. I will write a more discript review later but this will do for now. Never again.
author: Angelo F.

description: Without the 500 club I'm nothing, stinky carpets and all. Love the photo booth.
author: Kristen F.

description:
There is a time and a place for dive bars, and although last night might not have been time, the 500 Club was certainly the place!

Lets start out with the fact that a cosmo was only $6 AND it might've been the strongest I've ever had. Clearly nothing to complain about there! 

Moving on to the juke box. If I can put on Born to Run by Mr. Springsteen and dance like an idiot (you know, when you don't really dance, you just make over exaggerated gestures and sing along) in the middle of a bar without anyone blinking an eye, I'm clearly in a good place. Maybe not mentally for making the decision to do that, but that's another story. Even though I'm more of a fan of clubs, if you can cut loose at a place without feeling judged (I must say, kind of a rarity for most places in the mission) it's going to be good times.

Finally, and maybe most importantly, the photo booth. Having a photo booth can only make a place cooler. In no situation could you be at a bar and think, "Man, I wish that photo booth wasn't here." I'm sorry, it's just not going to happen. Nothing is better than waking up to ridiculous, fun, drunken photos from the night before, and there is something special about having ones that have been printed and aren't digital. You can't retake them over and over to get the "perfect" shot, and you are left with whatever memory is printed. I think that is just plain awesome, and therefore, I think this bar is 

just. plain. awesome.
author: Kelsey E.

description:
Key things to note about this place (and the reasons I likey):

-It's an old dive
-Old cracked booths that you get your clothes stuck in
-lengthy bar with plenty of seats to belly up at
-there's a billion hipsters
-there's a variety of other folk too
-dog friendly
-**photobooth in the back**
-same general vibe no matter who's in there
-Jukebox (for which you won't hear your song on a busy night)
-glorious flashy sign out front

I always have a good time here and it usually pretty busy.  A little too packed on the weekends but you can still manage to get a drink.  The bartenders are great unless you get the one who's got short man complex, but other than that a fantastic bar with a great selection for any time, any occasion.
author: Doxie M.

description: Went here 1-1-12 at 7pm'sh. Before I entered the bar,at a distance, I can see the tv which seems like mounted outdoors.  I mentioned to Emily the bartender one time, I wished their beers can be a little colder.  I went one other time, and they listened to me (I guess many patrons asked about that).  Now their beers taste better, had 2 sierra nevada hefeweizens and 2 guinesses (I noticed it's taste bitter with a hint of coffee---now see why many like that beer).  And of course, I sang several songs on that evening,if there's karaoke, I definitely enjoyed myself.
author: Jer W.

description:
This bar is like a second home to when I visit SF. We always end up there. I always seem to be low on cash when I get there, yet I always leave happy and usually quite drunk. The "Five" smells like the Mission and I am never offended. 

This is the type of establishment that my Los Angeles will never, ever be able to touch. I really like bars that are made for drinkin'! Not just for parading around with a $20 martini in stilettos with your head-shot and actor boyfriend who wears more hair product than any woman I know.

Thank you 500 for helping me drink gooder when in SF.
author: Rockie N.

description: I don't know how I wandered into this bar but it may have had something to do with the neon martini glass outside.  Bar reminds me of Alaska.
author: Suz L.

description:
This is the bar where we went to get completely hammered in the nineties. 

This is the bar where we went to have drunken relations with punk rock mission chicks.

This is the bar where we played pool until a fight broke out with some drunk maniac.

This is the bar where we listened to grunge/ punk music like Soundgarden, Alice and Chains, and Social Distortion.

Now that I have fallen off the wagon. 

This is the bar where I will return to relive the sleazy divey nineties........

I hear its the same ole' 5 Hundy.......I.E., one of the best dive bars in the city.

Like the wise man once said, "The more things change, the more they stay the same."

Cue Soundgarden Intro:

"Black hole sun, won't you come, and wash away the rain......
 Black hole sun, won't you come......won't you cah-ummm........"
author: Georgio N.

description: My friend insisted we hit this place, which was recommended as one of SF's best dive bars. Its charms were lost on me -- not that special, franklly, but the staff was very nice!
author: Chad S.

description:
I'll jump it to 4 stars.

I always find myself here, whether it's in times of celebration like my birthday, inauguration day (!!), or just regular nights when a friend is in town for the weekend.

Need more?
-You can see that Vegas-worthy sign from blocks away on Guerrero, and it'll make you happy every time you see it.
-Brand-spanking-new photo booth is fun, but pricey ($5 for two identical strips of four frames). But, most importantly, it works. They can be spotty hereabouts!
-There's always a dog in here. Maybe it's the same one?
-Great vibe and mix of folks.

Thanks, 500, for being there in the blurriest of times, and the not-so-blurriest of times.
author: Tara R.

description: Favorite punk bar!! Its a mixed crowd, I like that, I dont get the who are you, peacock vibe here!!! I can just chill and have a drink!!! And get waisted if I want!!!!
author: R. S.

description:
Spicy, peppery Bloody Marys.
Crock pot of corned beef and cabbage
Draft Guinness
Banquettes that are "old," not "retro"
Old friends
Nice staff
Six years between visits
PBR that's not ironic
Sunday morning drinks
Dog-friendly. Also bacon friendly.
Back door to let the sun shine in
Dark enough to blink a lot on the way out
A bad influence in a good sort of way
author: Matt R.

description:
the 500 club is one of my favorite bars in the mission.  I usually wander in on sunday funday, after Dolores park. I just love cheap beer and drunken kareoke (is there any other kind?) 
it's not a rare novelty to sit in one of the booths with friends and drink the afternoon away. 
It's also a good place to catch a Giants game. Locals only, no cheering for the Dodgers in here! #BEATLA!

cheers Emily!
author: Jevir G.

description: 500 club is cool.  great sandwiches next door at Claires and they bring them over to the bar to eat.  drinks are good.  A couple guy bartenders and guy bouncers think they are god(dude you work at a dive bar, just cause your life sucks don't take it out on the customers).  only turn off about this place.  Dick head male bartender/bouncer.
author: Mike K.

description:
I was on a slightly different depressant tonight. How being tired is like being drunk:

1.) I passed out in my living room when I got home.
2.) I woke up because I was thirsty, but didn't want to move.
3.) I stared at my tv remote for about a minute, wondering how I could drink it. "No... no, this doesn't make ANY sense at all..."

Over 14 hours of meetings and staring at a PC is enough to make any Jack go something something...

Go... crazy?

Don't mind if I do!! Zoop zoop!! Awooogah!!! Aroooogah!!!

Clif Bar + Diet Rockstar = I'm ready for DYL again. *Popeye wink and smirk*

I love how the 500 Club sign flashes on the street corner. Glitzy. I came after the happy hour deals ended, but well drinks were still only $5. The place was packed, but fun. There's a pool table and a photobooth: http://images.yelp.com/photo?id=MEZOCHE6pzNXSaa7l1ku1A&s=l (Yeah.. that freaky, pulled face at the bottom right is me.). There's an ATM inside and the restrooms aren't too crowded. Although, I still feel weird washing my hands next to a peeing dude.

I didn't do anything stupid tonight. I'm very proud of myself.
author: Keane L.

description:
Trumer on tap.  Yesssssss.  

Nothing like a nice shot of Fernet with a Trumer back.  That's what Rachel F and I both had.  Her heterosexual male roommate had an Amaretto and sour.  And other than me, nobody made fun of him.  That's pretty cool.  There was also a German shepherd in there that loved me. LOVED me.  I had to wash my hands three times because I couldn't stop myself from petting it.
