500 has been one of my favorite dives for at least a decade.  Check it - if you can handle it.

Think globally, drink locally.  And vote Obama/Biden!  Thanks :)
author: Joe C.

description:
So. If you're interested in checking out this bar because you like dives and you like the Mission, maybe you should NOT pick Superbowl Sunday for your initial visit. Learn from my mistake, in other words. I was already in the city and it was on the way to my destination, so I thunk to myself, "Why not?"

I'll tell you why not.

If it's not bad enough that EVERY dive bar in the known world has apparently been co-opted by hipsters, who are often neither poor NOR alcoholics (and often ARE one or the other, depending), the NFL, which you'd think would pass unnoticed by the hipsdar, seems to bring them out in droves. The main room of the bar was packed. It was hard to even order my drink, and finding a seat in there was out of the question.

Luckily, there's a second room. Where chips, etc, seemed to be being offered gratis (?), and there was a really hot guy with dreds watching the game (and I, in turn, watched him). 

The drinks were relatively reasonably priced, I suppose. My Shiner Bock (draft) was only $3, and they have $2 PBRs (hipster brew of choice!) and other bottled beers. But, being not quite cool enough to be a hipster, I felt a little overwhelmed by the presence. All things in moderation, that's my motto. Hipsters included.
author: Ashley M.

description:
Have you ever wondered about the meaning of names like Club 500? There is an entire field in philosophy called semiotics   that studies interpretations of signs and meanings. My conclusion is that, like yelpers running out of topics to write reviews on, prospective owners of clubs and Bars often run out of original ideas and copy names of other clubs and bars.

Our experience at Club 500 reconfirmed that hoisting DYL's in Dive Bars in the Mission is a good thing since yelper's get to take over the Bar and set the norms and standards for the night. 

At Club 500 last night, yelpers sure did set standards by instilling DYL   core values like drunkeness,  ass groping, making out etc. I have to admit that the Bar staff   fitted into our norms by plying us with moderately priced drinks and generally responding to our needs.

So why give it one less star than Thieves Tavern, our previous week's venue? The layout of the Bar inhibited energy flow and did not create the harmony of space(example: no place to dance).
author: Kaustav C.

description:
Despite the lame outdoor signage, this place is beyond awesome.

I accidentally stumbled into this building on an urban midnight hike and was drawn in by the young crowd hobbling at the door.  If you're not paying attention this place would seem like another generic corner liquor destination, but it is so much more than that.  It also feels like it attracts a kinder, less pretentious hipster element that isn't out to kick a puppy from being rejected yet again from bussing tables at St. Francis.

The 500 club is brimming with character most dive bars will never achieve -- a fine balance of disgusting and cozy, a delicate slant between filthy and warm.  

The drinks are cheap, the booths are legendary, and if you arrive early with your friends you can Bogart the karaoke area in the back while the rest of the bar longs for a closer view of your fat head.  Just don't forget to bring cash unless you're skilled at flattering cute strangers.
author: niero g.

description:
5 reasons to love the 500 club.

1. $2 PBR on nights you are just feeling cheap.  They also usually have "ladies night" specials.
2. Cozy round black leather booths that help you get to know your friends that much better.
3. Photoboothery antics.
4. They sell Sparks at the bar.  Not always a good idea, but its nice to have as an option.
5. The bartenders and regulars are all a bunch of characters, and want you to leave the bar drunk.  I usually do.
author: Lauren F.

description:
Pros:
=PHOTO BOOTH!
=Jukebox
=Cheap

Cons:
=Cash only
=Kinda pretentious hipster crowd
=Dirty
author: Jackie G.

description:
I had heard good things about this place, and when we first went in to check it out it seemed small.  On closer inspection what appeared to be a mirror was actually a whole other room.  Awesome.

Then, a selection of songs played on the jukebox (jukebox, score!) - old school David Bowie, followed by Morrissey, followed by Frank Sinatra in his younger years.  Groovy!

Went around the corner to explore this other room - a photobooth, cool!  Ms. Pac-Man, but wait, not just Ms. Pac-Man!  There's Dig Dug!  Frogger!  Donkey Freaking Kong!  Galaga!!!  In my excitement I immediately settled for a game of Frogger only to die instantly because it'd been too long since I played - I mean, a super frog like Frogger should be able to ride on cars and swim, right?  Right?!?  Bogus.

Happy hour is pretty decent, and $2 PBR for those on the cheap and/or just like PBR.   The seating is well-laid out too.  Tubular!

One thing to note is that if there's a lot of people there, you're better off going around to the main part of the bar to get your drink rather than getting the bartender to help you through the other side.  Also, it may or may not smell like vomit here - luckily I was blissfully unaware.  :]
author: Sus... B.

description:
This is one of those places that I've always been around, but for some reason I never made it inside. Until Monday night. And I'm super bummed that I went in and had such a good time. I don't need another dive bar to add to my list, and I certainly don't want another one that's as welcoming as this place is.

Trumer Pils on tap and the prices won't break you.

Minus one star for not being open at 6 am. Wait, it's probably a good thing that they're not open at 6 am.
author: Rachel F.

description:
Oh, I'm sorry did someone just clean the floor with stomach bile?  My mistake, you've just recycled old BART carpet to refurnish.  Oh, ok! 

What's that you say?  It's the sweet, sweet smell of making pahhrty??!!!  Well, in that case!! Gimme 2 PBR's and a double Fernet, ginger back.  THAT'S right, Chet!  It's time to get dirrrrrrrrrrtaaaaaaay!

500 club is comforting like your gramma's place - something always does smell a little funky, but shit, she knows how to fucking party.
author: Kelly H.

description: It's still a good dive bar with an eclectic Mission crowd. Our bartender made a nice Manhattan and we had a good time people watching. A good place to grab a drink after dinner.
author: Sheila T.

description:
I love dive bars. Dive bars are for the unpretentious and the alcoholic. I am these things (but no, this review is not a cry for help). 

I love fireplaces. They are for the cold. I am definitely cold. All the time. Before I moved to San Francisco I could give two shits about fireplaces. But now that I live in the land of perpetual cold and fog (WHAT IS UP WITH THAT?!), rendering ME perpetually cold and foggy (the foggy part comes from all the whiskey required to warm up my insides), fireplaces in a bar are more valuable to me than a toilet. 

Seriously. I'll go pee outside on the street. I will. Ask Nadja M. 

I don't even know if the 500 Club's fireplace works. Probably not. But it's there. 

I love PBR in bottles. Because it's cheap. I am also cheap. And I'm from the Midwest, and there we were taught that PBR is decent beer. You can take the girl out of the Midwest, but you can't take the Midwest out of the girl. 

So, add it all together and I love the 500 Club. Except on the weekends, when it's SUPER crowded. Because I don't love people all that much.

But 2:00 on a Friday -- my unpretentious, cold, foggy, cheap alcoholic self is in HEAVEN.
author: Lisa T.

description:
Continuing on our never-ending adventure to find my friend Ron a woman, we went bar-hopping again last Saturday all around the Mission.  We stopped by Skylark first, then the Elbo Room, then Delirium, then ended up at the 500 Club.  My god, the crazies we encountered that night.  It was awesome.

Our stop at the 500 Club started off with a round of beers for my two buddies and me.  Then this hot blonde chick with an eastern european accent started chatting me up about my wicked cute hat (don't hate) and we're talking and talking and then this other hot brunette chick wanders over to chat with us, except the brunette chick is TOTALLY WASTED.  I mean, out of her mind, EFFED UP.  The drunk one was dressed up in this naughty nurse's outfit and kept trying to listen to people's heartbeat with a broken stethoscope.  Here's a loose reenactment of what our conversation with her sounded like:

'saurus: "your outfit's pretty hot."
hot wasted chick: "thank you, i'm a doctor of the mickey mouse hospital" (flashes me her bra)
friend ron: "wow, that's excellent"
hot wasted chick (to me): "so, are you blonde or brunette?"
'saurus: "brunette, i guess.  i'm asian."
hot wasted chick: "no, you're a blonde.  you're a stupid blonde."
'saurus: "huh?"
hot blonde chick: "don't listen to her, she's crazy."
'saurus: "i'm confused."
hot wasted chick: "did you go to school, girly?"
'saurus: "yeah."
hot wasted chick: "well, you wasted your money because you're just a stupid blonde."
'saurus: "..."
hot wasted chick: "you're not taking me seriously, are you? (hugs me) because i love you.  i LOVE you."
friend ron: "i'm scared."

This went on for about 45 minutes.  Other people would wander over and chat with us and hot wasted chick would decide whether they were a "stupid blonde" or a "smart brunette" and if they were blonde (like me), they were only allowed to talk to other "stupid blondes."  Finally, right before they left, hot wasted chick was like, "So, are you blonde or brunette?"  And I'm like, "Ummm, I'm gay."  And she perks up, hugs me, grinds her punani into my knee, says good-bye and leaves.  My god, is this still planet earth?
author: Diana Y.

description:
We went here last night around 1:40AM, mainly because of its proximity to my friends house, after a great vodka drinking/Hanukkah cookie baking session.

I totally feel for bartenders at 2AM, trying to herd the drunks out of the bar. Its been a long time since I've been to this particular bar for that shining moment, but all in all, this is not a bad place to find yourself for last call.

 We were clearly not finished with our beverages as they said time to go....so as any good drinker does, I was drinking my beer while walking toward the door. The bartender decided I looked like one of those people who was going to take my drink out the door with me, and reminded me not to. I didn't even want to correct him, because I know how it is getting people to finish up and leave so I left my third of a beer on the bar and said I wouldnt dream of taking my beer outside (which is 100% true).

I guess he felt bad or something because he then said "No, no...you can stay and finish". I politely explained that I didnt want to chug my beer and thanked him for his hospitality. 

That, paired with the crazy old man in the rolling stones pajama pants, who did a little dance with me by the bathroom, made this a fairly pleasant last call experience.
author: Drue C.

description:
We found this place because we wanted to kill some time while waiting for our Delfina pizza.  Yes - just turned the corner and saw some bright light sign on the street and thought that it looked promising.

Well it was. Cheap drinks, some crazy tough looking regulars, and lots of things to keep you amused on the wall. 

Finding this little spot made me miss my old friends when we used to gallavant and frequent these kinds of dives....
author: Yelper A.

description:
At the tenth bar of Christmas I bought myself for me:
One Fernet
One vodka Red Bull
One PBR
One Fernet
One PBR
One PBR
One Jack and Coke
One PBR
One vodka Red Bull
One pint of PBR
I can tell that this bar is the shit.
Everybody seems to be having a great time here.
Plenty of room around the centered bar.
Good tunes.
Pretty people.
Nice street corner area to smoke and chat.
For some reason though, I've never been able to jive here.
It's truly a shame, I WANT to like this bar lots - yet I always leave disappointed.
It's me, not you.
author: Theo R.

description:
The 500 Club is your garden variety dive bar: strong drinks and 6 am opening time for the career alcoholics. It's also canine-friendly, so you can drink with your pooch. 

They really should clean their carpets though. Seriously, the stench makes me throw up in my mouth a little.
author: Suzanne R.

description:
Why do I like the 500 Club?

Simple.

In the week that I was in SF and in the 10 or so times I drank in and walked past this place, I saw the following...

-a hipster wearing gold shoes
-a thugged out gangsta dude in sunglasses, a sideways baseball hat and a gold chain
-a dude who spit out his beer through his nose after laughing really hard (and if that dude is reading this, I only judged you for like, a minute or so, it was actually pretty funny and I hope your nose feels better real soon)
-a girl who pulled off plaid and polka dots at the same time (don't try this at home)
-a really old lady who wandered in, looked lost and then left after high fiving someone

It's a random bar and you will see random things here and for that, I give the 500 5 random stars, because you always keep me entertained and the people judging, um, I mean watching is awesome! Hella awesome even ;)

cash only.
author: Stephy S.

description:
Yes, there are hipster tard a plenty here. After my coworkers and I found out we were all getting laid off, we went on a cheap pub crawl which ended here. I kind of like the vibe. It was laid back and felt like a bar I'd expect to find Kurt Russell in.

If you haven't noticed, I like places that attract talkative people and there was no shortage here. Though I think we got a lot of attention because we were wearing our work clothes while everyone was in their "artist" uniform, haha.

I like this place and I have made it one of my first stops on the way through the Mission. Or maybe it's because they have an ATM inside..
author: Ryan V.

description: Lately I've been stopping by here to catch up on the boys (& girls) of summer. .excellent place for Gigantes fans* ( & possibly a nefarious D'backs fan or two ;p +awesome jukebox & theBurger at Clare's next door rocks!. . .thanks Sudz, Bone, Jeffrey, & Simone for keepin' it real, C U @ theFIVE!
author: John B.

description:
I've been going here "a lot" recently, which isn't necessarily representative of preference, but certainly due to convenience. It's close to work, but off the beaten path of Valencia and 16th, making it accessible, but much less crowded. Have never had a problem finding a place to perch with a cheap(er) beverage. 

Some of the draw was due to the old polaroid photo booth (I have photogenic friends, ok?) that took a vacation for a bit. It has since been replaced by a new photobooth that reeks of suburban mall and Fisherman's Wharf, a strange addition to such a dive.
author: haley d.

description:
Dom you the man... I order a double and dem der beeza triple jack and whoooaa!!!  It must have been the new gold dollar coins I TIPPed him with because he tried to knock me off the barstool with all dem der drinks.  Luckily for me, Black People don't get drunk or I'd still be laying on the floor ;0)

How do you not give a place 4 stars when you never had to wait very long to get a drink?  The place was packed and still a triple whoa in hand within 3 minutes.  Here's to you 500 Club.  I'd make you Elite if you were a Yelper.

Warning:the picture booth is great for blackmale... believe me.  I know!
author: Jamal G.

description:
Affordable drinks.
Good service.
Great jukebox.
Walking distance to Arinell's.

How did I not know there was a photobooth?!
How did my pink hat make the round of pictures but not me?!
author: Aim E.

description:
The 500 club looks like a local dive in a depressed factory town, and it's full of metal and new wave guys in addition to the burly truck driver types. There are lots of ads for commodity beers on the wall, some country and 70's rock in the jukebox, and a TV playing 80's hair metal videos in the corner. 

But here's a secret: All of these people are really really cool. Much cooler than you and I will ever be.

Why do they do this? who knows. If you don't know why you're here than you probably don't belong.
author: matthew r.

description:
I hate when people (in their mid to late twenties) say 
"Back in the day"

Really?
What day was that precious, last Thursday?

I'll be specific: Back in the mid to late 80s (yeah, I was legally drinking booze  then, while little "back in the day" was drinking amniotic fluid, no doubt) this place was a scary hole.

I used to hang at the 500 with my boss (whom I considered a savvy thirty something with lots of grit)  This was back when my delicate self could only handle beer and the occasional cognac.

Cut to coming back from lands far far away (Los Angeles) to get my Bachelor's degree, in the middle of the flipping dot-com explosion.

Everywhere one looked, there were six-figure hipsters who had nothing better to do with their time or money.  Basically, I stopped going out for the hipster-induced nausea seeing all my favorite places turned to some blogable event.

Cut to the Bush years--everyone is out a job, back in school, the hipsters have left, gone back from whence they came (thank Jesus) and it's now safe to go back out at night without the nausea and disgust of seeing twenty-somethings swilling back the trendy drink of the moment.

I like the scruffiness of this place--there's no Shee-shee clothes, no wannabes, the bar tenders are cool, and a gal in her early forties still gets looks while she sits and enjoys her vodka tonic quietly.

the "no pretensions allowed" attitude sits well with me.
author: Lisa B.

description:
ok, people - I've got the high score on Wordster (about 120,000) on the video game machine across from the bar.  it hasn't been unplugged since at least January 6th when I got the high score.  I challenge you all to beat my record...

Update: I worked Wordster over for 136,000 on Wednesday 3/29/06.  sweet!

Update: someone unplugged the machine!  No matter, the high score is now 133,000 as of Thurs 4/6/06.

Update: sadly I moved to the other end of the Mission and haven't been to the 5-hundy since July.  Anybody want to let me know what the high score is now?
author: Gabriel D.

description:
I really feel it, I really do.

I have been dying to try the 500 club for so long now. I knew once I saw that giant neon martini glass blazing over Guerrero St that I would be a big fan. A friend warned against it, saying that it was all homeless, old people or trannies. Instantly I wanted to go even more because that sounds like a good scene, but it turned off all of my other friends. What losers. I didn't want to come alone, because that's so alcoholic, so I  had to put my dreams on hold. After months of whining, along with the great yelp reviews, I convinced my friends to tag along. So glad we finally went. 

I loved it. It was a very mixed crowd. The whole place had a very chill vibe, very comfortable. The drinks were great, almost ALL booze and only like 4 dollars. I had fun. Loved the space, will be back again and again.
author: Bobby P.

description:
Smelled like vomit and reminded me of a cross between a white trash basement and a redneck bar in Ohio.  

There were more teeth per capita, but the music was about what you'd expect to hear in either of the above places.  

Putting carpet in this bar is about as genius as upholstering the BART cars.  How am *I* still unemployed?
author: Alissa K.

description:
Last night, we came here only because it was my date's sister's 22nd birthday.  Delirium was too crowded so, they decided to bring the party (about 11 people) to 500 Club.  

I had a bad vibe about this bar the second I walked in -- the foul odor didn't help either.  It was very stinky in here, and everyone seemed to have smelled it.  Best way to describe it was what I heard one guy say, "Dude, what's the smell? Smells like ass."  Ha!  I really think it's just beer and other cocktails that spilled on the carpet that was making the whole place smell like a sex club.  I don't like it.  Everyone seem so cliquey and into themselves.  I loved the fireplace, the pool tables, jukebox and cheap bottled PBRs :-)!

I would never go back here again unless I am forced to because there are so many other bars that I like better in the Mission.  Nevertheless, I enjoyed the experience of having to try a new bar and spending time with some really cool people.  The highlight of my night was being carried out of the bar by my date as I placed my hand around his neck  -- he's so romantic.
author: Celeste M.

description:
Dear 500 Club,

You had me at the red shag carpeting.  PBR specials swept me off my feet.  But pin the tail on the donkey?  What's more fun than being drunk, blindfolded, and wildly trying to stick a super-sized tack into the wall?  Wow, you really know how to keep a man coming back.

Sincerely,

Justin B.
author: Justin B.

description:
Oh sweet nectar of the gods, come into my boozum and warm me from within.

This is not a pretty place nor is it a clean place, but it is a place where you can get a proper drink and watch the world go by.  

This is not a "nice" place for cocktails or an after dinner drink place. for that , you can find many other bars which are cleaner, less crowded and have a better pour.  But if you are looking to get paralyticly drunk with many friends and hit on anything that has a pulse, then this is the place for you.
author: Jai D.

description:
Know those times when you have just had a really shitty day?Your dog was raped, your fish died, your landlord isnt going to renew your lease, and you're thinking you should really get that genital rash checked out.Those are the kind of days that science has yet to find a cure for, but bars have been providing treatment for such afflictions for centuries.Well what if you dont get paid for two more days, and you only have a small bit of spending cash?Then the 500 Club is your place.For just a little more than bus fare you can get a nice, cold, PBR.You know when its pulled out of the ice cooler, and looks like its just sweating?You watch the frigid water slowly drip down the bottle, and think of puppies, your first orgasm, ice cream, and all the pain just seems to slowly fade away........
 
I only count off points for this place because one of the bartenders plays this one mix cd that is full of the shittiest alt-country bullshit, you've never heard of.
author: Joshua T.

description:
I felt at home as soon as I walked in.  The karaoke, the drinks, the cute boys, the photo booth...

really, I can't get any better.  GO!

If I wasn't working right now, I'd be there.
author: Rikki G.

description:
This place is a bit of a trek off from the mission... about 2 blocks.  I know right?  Anyway came here for my friend's birthday and it's a sweet little place.  Good crowd but there was enough space that I was able to get from our group's tables to the bathroom and back without having anyone spill beer on me so that's already an extra star right there.  

And then there's the great deals at happy hour and then the $2 PBRs the rest of the night so that's one more star.  

And there's a photo booth.  +1 more star.  

I lost count so I'm just gonna give them 4.
author: William S.

description:
Dive = afraid to put my hand in the bar pretzels bc, well, they didn't exactly look clean. 

Ever worked in a fast food place where the new product goes behind or underneath the new, so that the old is served first? esp important at Chinese all you can eat buffets, and pretty imp at a bar. don't dig deep is my best advice. 

Bar = all the drinks you need, served sharp and hard without a lot of fuss and mid range prices. if you say something dorky, you know, implying that you are not an alcoholic in your spare time, be prepared for a wee bit of snippyness. this is for those most def in the "know".

lots of seating options, amazing location near all the Valencia street thrift shops, so you can drink up before fawning over things you don't need and aren't sure fit. 

amazing people watching bc there are all types in here. ALL. 

most definitely a repeat for me!
author: Miel H.

description:
You've got to like a bar with drinks this strong and cheap, and with this much Springsteen on the jukebox.  My friends and I also liked wincing at the women's wrestling on TV, and we admired the hilarious life-sized ZZ Top poster.  We were lucky to snag a cozy booth for four with a swell view of it all.

I'd heard this was a biker bar, but my friend observed last Friday's crowd looked more "piratey," with lots of peacoats and nautical hats. They were a friendly crowd, too, the sort of place where strangers wish you happy new year and clink your glass, even though it's not even NYE.
author: angela n.

description:
The little bar that could...the 500 Club.

Size - small
Temp - warm
Crowd-cool

I caught up with the SF DYL after my boys night out had little boys hours due to my buddies other commitments.  I wasn't planning to go at all, so my showing up was last minute.  I didn't know what to expect.

I heard about $2 PBR, and that's what I spent the evening with.  The thing that stood out most to me was the bartenders.  They were great.  Super nice.  Pretty quick.  Really didn't have to wait long to make and order or get that order filled.  Thank you 500!  On top of that, a conversation about chillin in backyards on hot summer nights lead to the Suffering Bastard.  This has become a favorite of ours, thanks to Tikibar TV.  The bartender was more than willing to give it a shot even though it wasn't a familiar drink.  They mixed a good one, cause our pal Angelo has become a fan.  In case you were wondering, Tikibar is a free podcast that's easy to find and the drink is as follows:

    * 1 1/2 oz Gin
    * 1/2 Bourbon
    * 3 oz Gingerale
    * 1/2 Lime
    * Sprig of Mint

Enough of that.  The 500 Club was a few blocks from 16th St BART in the Mission, so it was easy to get to and from the East Bay.  I liked the atmosphere of this place.  Classic mirrors of some fav drinks.  Seating was good.   The photo both was big enough for 2, so we jammed in 4 plus a chihuahua.

Check it out sometime.  Make the SB a local fav, would ya?
author: Steve N.

description:
I'm sitting here feeling sorry for myself because I have a cold and I've been house-bound for two days and I think back to Friday happy hour with the Yelpers (where I most likely weakened my immune system).

It was a great night.  

I met a lot of really sweet and sexy people, got a free 'first-timer' drink from Matt H., an official Omid. T 'reach-around' (to be his next coupon I'm sure), a cute pic with cute-as-a-bug Me A, and I witnessed Maria D. (and others) singing Whitesnake at the top of their lungs.

And now I'm sniffling, eating soup and tossing back Robitussin.  

It was so worth it.

Oh and despite the crowd of people, the bartenders were really fast and accommodating and the greyhounds were $4.  My kind of place.
author: Alice S.

description:
LEGIT.

I was only there for a couple of drinks before a show but I noticed this joint has all the components of a good bar:

*low-key vibe
*fast, efficient bartenders with lead wrists (the first vodka cran was solid. Thanks, guys!)  
*low lighting (esp. good if you are on a blind date with someone that is not that attractive, not that it has happened to me but...uh...if you know...someone else was on a bad blind date.)
author: MakeUp M.

description:
Why did the bartender give me tequila with soda and a lime? 

I'm still not sure because I asked for a scotch. I was so pissed because tequila and soda is not even a drink. I asked for McCallan and the bartender didn't know what it was. Once I tasted my drink, I waited forever to exchange it for what I wanted. I was waited on by a different bartender who acted like he didn't believe me when I got the wrong drink. He looked at me disbelievingly and said "Whattttttt?" I passed him the (undrank) tequila and he glared at me when I didn't tip him for the corrected drink.

I actually do really like this place but I'm not sure why - maybe it's vibe. Or the photo booth. Just.. AVOID THIS PLACE ON KARAOKE NIGHT unless you're self loathing/way drunk off whatever the bartenders feel like giving you.
author: Sylvia P.

description:
My new friends kept telling me I had to go to the 500 Club because I'd love it there (and the guys are cute).  So a few weeks later, we walked into the 500 on a Saturday night and as I was sitting at the bar, throwing back shots, $2 PBRs and flirting with the bartender, I realized I'd been there before.  On Thanksgiving eve, a friend and I stumbled into the 500 to celebrate my birthday.  We were wasted $10 later.  I LOVE THIS PLACE.

Plus any bar with a photobooth = good times (photos make up for your lack of memory after a good night of drinking :)).
author: Wendy T.

description: Dive bar w/ karaoke (think Pixies, The Smiths).  Fun!
author: Becky G.

description:
It takes more than just dirt, drugs and cheap drinks to make a good dive bar.

You need cheap, GOOD drinks. Drugs are optional, but shouldn't be a qualifier. Dirt comes with the territory, as does attitude, as long as it's smart, sassy, relaxed and cool attitude.

The 500 Club has none of that.
author: Tatjana G.

description:
Like a submarine Dive! Dive! Dive! 

Dive bar
Dive bathroom
Dive into some cheap drinks
Dive into some good conversation with friends
Dive into bed with all your clothes on when you've had too much to drink
author: Po L.

description:
Images that stood out for me:

A table of people in blazers and scarves stacking their Tecate cans high
A young man with tattered clothing and hair drawing in a notebook all night
No one is beautiful but almost everyone is fuckable

Sorry, not sure where that last one came from, although it was true.

I actually like the idea of the hipster-populated dive bar, but this spot was too crowded for me and my group of six to hear a word any of us said. And that probably means the true hipsters have moved on and wouldn't be caught dead in here.

Some positives: Great bar staff. Very good prices. Close to other bars. Decent juke box.
author: Trey C.

description:
standard dark, dive bar... that is set up to be that way.  Nice, but not some authentic juke joint as much as madde that way.

Jukebox music.... but problems loom as "people are totally crazy and not sharing jukebox privileges".  Oh well.  Enjoy!
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description:
Their sign outside  is so Vegas, and I love it.

It's pretty divey, and it smells a little kooky in here, but who cares! There's a photobooth that spits out photos INSTANTLY. And the drinks are strong and cheap... just how I like 'em. Amy Winehouse, Smokey Robisnson and the Scissor Sisters were being played in the background, I enjoyed it. Yes I did.

Come here with some cool pals and you will have a great time!
author: Richard T.

description:
The defining characteristic of the 500 club is that it is perhaps the only neighborhood bar in a neighborhood with zillions of bars.  

Still, it gets as mobbed as the rest of them taking the overflow from the ruinous debacle taking place down by 16th and valencia any given weekend.

I'd say I was sad to see the pool table go, but i was almost impossible to play in that back room in the first place.
author: joe b.

description:
As wayward sailors used to look for their lighthouse to lead them home (and wrote rueful odes to it when leaving again), I look to the glowing martini in the sky-- a martini that has apparently blinded me from seeing the open waters of possibility in any neighborhood beyond The Mission, but nonetheless. . .

500 Club got me my new job. 500 Club has Howard (see my profile pictures), and Howard is always a good time-- he'll dance with you, you just have to ask. 500 Club is also the only place where I've been in a bar fight. 500 Club has the best random-girls-in-the-bathroom conversations. And at 500 Club you can talk to anyone about what's playing on TV because it's likely a cultural touchstone. . . like The Goonies or Terminator. Films that really matter. Films that remind of us of our humanity in the way only PBR and skinny dive bars can.
author: Chelsea B.

description:
This is another one of my reviews that I am giving five stars on personal experience alone.  

I used to live right around the corner from the 500 Club and passed it daily on my way home.  While I admired the neon cocktail glass (what queen wouldn't?) I was never inclined to go in there.  One night my 82-year-old neighbor and I were and our way home from a "date" at Beach Blanket Babylon and as the cab approached she said, "Let's stop here I wanna go to the 500."  

We went in and she proceeded to tell me all about the 500 Club years ago and all her adventures in SF.  As she got more tipsy her stories became more vibrant and she attracted a little crowd.  Everyone listening was so diverse, interested and kind.  I think it was the best night out my friend had had in years.

Have I been back since?  No.  But, the 500 Club holds a special place in my heart for a wonderful memory.
author: Sean O.

description: are you on the fence? well stay there. balls to the wall, baby!
author: Shell S.

description: I used to live 5 minutes from here and i think the 500 club is great. It's a small dive bar with a nice atmosphere and a photo both in the back :) Also is close to Dolores Park and Valencia Street, so a great place to start off the night. The drinks are also pretty strong, so they're not trying to cheat you out of your liquor here.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
I think I blame my not so perfect experience at the 500 club on me somehow putting it in such glorified statues in my mind.  To me, it seemed like it might be one of the last true bars that hasn't been turned into just another hipster bar in the mission.  Also, for some reason I thought it still opened at 6 a.m. - Boy was I wrong!!!

Even at 2pm on a Monday, don't count on the 500 club being there for when you need a drink - they don't open till 3pm.  

*********Bloody Mary Review**********
Being as it that the 500 Club prides itself on being a somewhat bar for drinkers, I also had high expectation for the tender to serve me up a nice bloody mary.  I thought things were looking up when it was taking her awhile to make them.  Usually when it comes to BM, time and quality have a strong correlations - well, not in this case.  I can't say it tasted awful, but it was just bland.  It wasn't spicy, it was tangy, it just was blahhh.......

Now I have to say that it could have been a fluke and/or just got a bartender that wasn't up on her bloody mary making skills.  If folks have had a good one here - please let me know and I'll make the effort to give them another shot.  Until then, I can't say I'm itching to go back. 

Somehow I wish I might have been around when the 500 Club was in its hayday - I have a funny feeling it was my type of bar at one point in time.  

I'm sure I'll be there again and see if my review change. 

Till then....cheers!
author: Josh M.

description: The best part about this bar is the sign. If they didn't have the sign I'd never go in. It is smaller than small, and a total dive, and its usually too cool for me.
author: Jordan P.

description:
I was SHOCKED to find Jerry still working behind the bar at this place as of a couple of years ago. That guy's been hardcore since the Eisenhower administration and doesn't show any signs of slowing down. 

I love this place in the early afternoon. By 8PM it's way too crowded to deal with.
author: Andrew L.

description: This is one of the cheapest dive bars in San Francisco, but somehow it seems like a good middle ground between an actual shitty dive bar and some of the usual kind-of-not-expensive bars over on Mission. Plus the food from next door is pretty rad.
author: Klevin D.

description:
Bring your out-of-town friends here if they want to experience the quintessential super-cool SF dive bar.

It always seems to be a healthy mix of bikers (think Harleys, not fixies) and hipsters (think fixies, not Harleys). Plus there's punk rock on the jukebox, and a legitimate photo booth in the back.
author: Trey F.

description:
If we lived in a normal city, the 500 club would be a dive bar.  However, in SF, right on Guerrero, it is a trendy place for young white people masquerading as a dirty shit-hole.

Regardless, I like it.  I am a young white person and I gentrify things by my very nature, and I just can't help it.  Sorry stinky old men with yellowed mustaches.  Sorry fat old hookers with missing teeth.  Sorry nervous lady with a dog and stories about the glory days of 1969.  You are all victims of gentrification, and the 500 club doesn't need you anymore.
author: Dana M.

description:
THE spot to play the following games:

Hipster or Homeless?
Hipster or Hooker?

and last but not least,

Hipster or Foreigner?

My hipster wanted a Hoegaaden on tap, or a Chimay maybe?
author: Jennifer O.

description:
Dive. Bar.

No seriously.

There are dogs sitting on stools in here.

Go here. Have a PBR. Be nice to the doggies. You'll probably have fun.
author: Matthew R.

description:
I don't get it. 

Why does a self proclaimed "Dive Bar" have such attitude? Non attentive bar tenders, and it wasn't that cheap. A vodka tonic was undrinkable. Bathrooms were disgusting and too small for a place that size. Super crowded on a Saturday night which is to be expected, but people kept stepping on my toes! 

This place is not special. Much better bars in the Mission.
author: Halley B.

description:
Oh my god.  I LOVE THIS BAR.  Before last night I was only here a couple times.  I can say that they make a really sexy bloody mary AND put out really yummy bar snacks when you get there at noon.  

And then I went last night.  The bartender that was working when I got there wasn't all that friendly.  That's okay.  She poured me a luscious glass of Jameson all the same.  I guess she left after my first cocktail.  My fellow drunk and I decided that we really needed shots of Jager with SPARKS as a chaser.  Delicious.  

By this point our bartender was a friendly fellow named *Name Changed to Protect the Innocent*.   Was I in love?  Strangely...no.  While a bartender named *Name changed to protect the innocent* is pretty much my dream man, this guy wasn't a knuckle dragger.  I like knuckles on the ground.  He was quite the good sport when my friend asked for Sparks up in a martini glass.  And then, out of nowhere, *Name changed to protect the innocent* started buying our drinks.  All of them.  And giving me shots when my male cohort walked away.  I figured he just liked giving away booze or something.  But my friend, being a male, clued me into the fact that *Name Changed To Protect The Innocent* probably liked me.  At the time I found this really implausible.  I'm not the kind of girl that boys like normally.  

But looking back on it....the fact that he gave me all those drinks, asked for my number (for financial advice, natch), wanted me to put some stuff on the jukebox, and may or may not have had a cigarette with me....it's possible he may have had some level of interest.  But then I ruined it by getting too drunk and being a wasted loser.  Fuck me.

I'm sorry, *Name Changed to Protect the Innocent*.  I really really am.  

But five stars for 500 Club!  WooooO!

One thing though.  Don't be fooled by the sign.  They DO NOT open at 6 AM.  At least, not when I've been looking for a bar at that time.  That always pissed me off about the place.
author: Coco D.

description: Does not appeal to me. I've been there only a few times. Looks dirty inside and out. I do recall drink prices seemed reasonable.
author: L. A.

description: This is my kinda place! Found it randomly while walking around Mission. I was in San Fran for a weekend visit and found this on our last day! Loved the bartender, loved the patrons, the decor inside and out. Great juke box, strong drinks. Wish I would have found it earlier in my trip. I'm in love with these kinds of dive bars!
author: Melissa C.

description:
So years ago, a girlfriend and I got dragged to a house party in the Mish.  Here we stood with Manic Panic shades of hair and combat boots amidst a group that seemed more vanilla than the cast of Friends.  Our friend who insisted this party would rock felt obligated to stay for some minimum allotment of time.  Meanwhile, the other two of us huddled frightened, and holding hands in the corner until we couldn't take any more.

I realized I saw a bar at the corner and we told friend #3 that she could meet us there.  Together, we made our escape to the 500 Club.  As we walked through the door, I nearly got knocked out as a punkrocker launched a bottle through the air, narrowly missing my head.  Needless to say, we felt much more at home.

That was my first visit to the 500 Club.  I friggin' love that place!
author: Amy A.

description:
Erotic Photo Hunt and Wordster draw even my non-drinking friends to the 5hundy, the best dive bar ever. If you haven't played EPH, think of that game you used to play as a kid in the back of Highlights magazine where you had to pick the differences between two similar pictures. Now throw in some boobies and cheesy poses, and there you go!

Drinks are cheap, jukebox has good tunes, and if Bandit the dog is there, she'll do the coolest trick. Throw a coaster her way, and after she catches it, she'll THROW IT BACK AT YOU. No joke. Best trick I've seen. And what other bar has a huge twinkling neon sign outside with martini glasses and "OPEN 6:00 AM" written under it?
author: jenn h.

description: You either like this place or you don't- great mix of people in this classic SF dive. SF is a good dive bar town versus some sterile cities in the midwest. Anyway, great place to pass the day away and have a few brews.
author: Jim B.

description:
Nice staff for 90% of the night, managed to throw out 2 dudes who were harassing us before we even had a chance to ask the bartenders to do so. The guys were friendly and conversational all night while I was drinking and spending money.......

 I like the place, and the vibe. Unfortunately there was belly-dancing(?!) going on and I didn't get to sample what was a promising jukebox, there wasn't a single buy-back to be had (do they do buybacks in SF?) and the bathroom REEKS of mildew. 

  I was wasted at 2am and asked one of the staff to call me a cab. I said I was from out of town. He tried and got no response and directed me outside saying there were tons of cabs. As they herded people out I exclaimed there wasn't a cab in sight, and the other bartender told me to come in and he'd make sure I got one. The first guy blocked my path and I repeated what the other guy said, he all but shoved me out the door saying "He was kidding, and there's cabs on the next block", not indicating in which direction as we were on a corner, and proceeded to slam the door in my face. 

   Wow. As a lady all by myself I've not EVER had that happen before. In his defense he was on sobriety day 3. So I'm sure his patience/temperament weren't at their best. Too bad. 

  I'd try it out again, I think, though, better armed with transportation plans and I'd leave by 1:30am. It's tough when you are from NYC to roll up so early!!!
author: Amelia P.

description:
The benchmark for a neighborhood bar as far as I'm concerned.

Cash only is a bummer but if you know ahead of time its no prob...plus they have an ATM on site.

The bathrooms are...hmmm, how do I put it delicately?  Divebaresque.

The pool table is well used and the patrons are always friendly and open to challenges.  just watch your stick room on crowded nights.

The bartenders are always on top of things and speedy.

The booths are perfect for a group of 4-6.  Perfect.

The jukebox is great and cheap.  

The doormen are always friendly as well as the other denizens of the 500 Club.

Go, plop down, drink, and enjoy yourself.
author: Chris D.

description:
This joint may be crowded as hell when you come in, but don't despair. Getting a drink is actually pretty easy, especially because they serve you from both sides of the bar. The side with the photobooth is usually less crowded. While you're there, have a photobooth challenge with your friends. It's $3 for 4 pics displayed on a polaroid. 

You'll find a decidedly lively, laid-back and unpretentious crowd at the 500, and for the Mission it's surprisingly unhipsterish. You can also get PBRs for cheap, which is the only way PBR should be served. Just gives you a pretty good feeling being here.

And I give props to any bar with a good old-fashioned jukebox.
author: Andrew K.

description:
This is a nice place to hang out for a bit on a Friday night. They made their drinks strong. I LOVED that it did not smell of stale alcohol. The bathrooms were clean and bright, but yet not so bright as to cause headaches among its more inebriated patrons (how is that accomplished).
I was not feeling the bloody mary--even remotely-- but their vodka/grapefruit juice was just perfect.
author: sibani b.

description: Best darn Bloody Marys. Friendly bartenders. Good jukebox. Kareoke every other sunday rules!
author: Sprout S.

description:
i've had some good times at the 500 club.  some right good times, i tell ya'.  located in the mission (dolores park side) it's jam packed with all varieties of hipsters you can possibly imagine.

one time, at the 500 club, some random guy spilled my drink and i told the bartender, and he gave me a new one.  for free.  so for that, i think this place is grand.

+ booth seating
+ quieter seating area on the lefthand side

- gets really hot inside
- disgusting bathrooms
author: Lauren P.

description: I have no idea what ppl are talking about. I came in here and literally walked out after 5 mins. I guess that is the meaning of "dive" bar? This place is small and the music was tasteless. 1star for cheap drinks. Thats about it.. I wouldn't watch sports here..the tvs are so small! The booths were peely. If you just want a cheap drink, come here.
author: Kelly C.

description:
This place has changed!  A couple of years ago it was 3 people and the barkeep watching Discovery Channel on Sunday nights, now its packed and there's some drunk sorority types giving each other piggy back rides around the bar.  The old clientle is still here, and so are the bartenders, but the place, like bad meatloaf, has been filled out with the human equivalent of Wonder Bread.

I'm not gonna give the 500 less stars for all that, a fine bar: decent prices, decent juke, and they were showing the original "Rollerball" on one of the TV's last night.  Despite being pointlessly plotted that's one movie where the art director was allowed to run amok, and thankfully so, while not quit "Barbarella", it is a fine piece of future-retro design. 

The stale beer smell has always been a problem though and despite the change in patrons it remains, but one gets used to it after a drink or two.  Also there's the crazy ancient orange clad pool shark.  Beware, he may seem insane (and is I think), but he will kill ya at pool if there's money on the table.

Edit: Sometime mid 2007 - Pool table gone,replaced with pine benches and single polaroid photobooth that serves mainly for frat trash to take pictures of their junk with.  Orange Jumpsuit also gone, first the redman, now this.
author: Gustie L.

description:
***Week of One Sentence Reviews; June 9-13, 2008*****

One of my all time favorite dives bars in the city, every time I walk into the dank restroom I get flashbacks that you don't need to know about.
author: Richie C.

description: Wonderful dive bars are like rare gems.  The 500 Club sparkles!  Dark, divey, cheap common drinks, karaoke so bad it's fun.  Ask for the Pussy and Dumplings.
author: Kris P.

description:
Man, it's been since pre-kids since I've spent any real quality time at the 500 Club, but for the sake of posterity and nostalgia, I feel compelled, mostly for the sake of self-respect, to offer an endorsement of the best in dive bars (and I mean that with the utmost of respect).

Great drinks.
Shady clientele.
Awesome jukebox.
Sticky floors.

Did I mention great drinks?  A man can be nostalgic can't he?
author: Brad P.

description:
This place makes me happy.  So happy that I had my boyfriend's welcome to the city party here.  Its a Mission institution and brings me joy that years before my love frequented its beaten black booths.  Additionally, during Easter a group of bunnies and one anti-bunny (moi) convened on the 500 backroom for an hour or two of debauchery.  
Awesome Bloody Mary's for a dive and one of the only places with a Jukebox and photo booth (but at $5 a pop its a major SF-style ripoff).  
Furthermore, this is a mid week stop, because unfortunately the Marina creep has made its way to the 500 and unless you want to be completely frustrated I say stay away and hit up something else (or a friend's backyard).
author: Sheila Y.

description:
I'm really not big on the Mission. Everyone raves about it and granted it does have a crap load of choices when it comes to bars but most of them just don't speak to me. Just not my scene I guess.

But a friend of mine likes doing bar crawls around here so I acquiesce once in a while. Who knows? Might find something new that I like in the plethora of Mission bars.

By the time I got to 500 Club I was ready to go home. Or at least to a house party near my home. But everyone else wanted a beer so I just waited it out and took in the place.

Assessment: cheap drinks, good lighting, funky atmosphere. Definitely better than most I have been introduced to in the Mission.

And then it happens. I hear "Night Time is the Right Time" come on. What??? A bar with Ray Charles on the jukebox? I must be dreaming!

For all the cool lighting, cheap drinks & fun atmosphere that the 500 club has to offer, I'll be back for the jukebox. Sex Pistols & Dean Martin on the same effing page. It really doesn't get better than that.
author: Alexis B.

description:
Been here with my bad friend Alicia - it's cozy inside and it's a great place to knock back a few, talk shit, and cackle. It's a dive, but not such a deep dive that your head will explode when you come up. More than likely you'll be able to make it through the night without being involved in a conversation that touches on prison time.

It's a border establishment, halfway between the Castro and the Mission, but far enough from both mellow their influence. Nice mix of people.

A better neighborhood bar.
author: Karsten P.

description:
We have wasted years inside the 5. I've seen it all in this bar & I'd say it's one mere rung under Benders (it will return!) on the debauchery ladder. I have photos from the booth that should be burned, but they are essential, harsh reminders about the dangers of excess. The barstaff are sexy even when they're surly. Dog friendly makes it a bonus.

Aug 08- The facelift is awesome! No more stinky carpet, beautiful hardwood and flat screen tvs. Way to keep yourself sexy!!
author: Colleen B.

description:
Let's make it very clear that I am not qualified to write this review. Because I am not a 500 Club girl.  How so?

I drink fancy drinks (relax, we're not talking pomegranate appletinis, but you know, um, premium spirits) - not beer out of a can.  I wear fancy shoes - the kind you don't want beer from a can spilled on.  And you know, clean bathrooms are important to me.

But despite those odds, I had a good time.  It was kind of like being in a movie - like a Hollywood version of a Milwaukee dive, where grizzly gray-bearded regulars mixed with too-cool hipsters accompanied by their ratty dogs (yes, I was shocked to see real (ie non-purse) dogs in a bar.  Is that legal?).

Yeah.  I was out of my element.  Besides the really out-of-place mom-haired girl wearing a turquoise sweater and high school Tiffany chain I so evilly snickered at, I was probably the most marina-looking person there.  Ooh.  That hurts.
author: Melissa B.

description: Beer, booze and bad-ass jukebox. What's not to love about a perfect dive?
author: Nora M.

description:
A solid 3.5 stars to the 500 Club. With the giant lit up sign outside and the wood panelling inside, this place just seems like it should be in Reno to me. It's fun in the way that Reno's fun-great for a defined length of time. Say 3 hours or so. Those 3 hours are usually tons of fun, though.

On my last visit, the crowd consisted of  the following:

-Hipsters swilling PBR and enjoying the ironic tees worn by the other patrons
-WAY too drunk girl, who went to sit down by the fire, nodded out and almost set her (super cute) orange jacket ablaze
-Brawling dudes (literally on the floor, brawling) who claimed possession of drunk girl and took her outside, whereupon all three of them passed out against the wall. She's lucky I didn't roll her for that cute jacket.
-Guy with head in hands looking forlorn and probably contemplating what he's done with his life/why she'll never love him as much as she loves Brandon Flowers/what to call his French bulldog
-Bartender pulling drunk girls out of the fire/answering random trivia/talking on the phone and generally taking care of business. 

Good times. Good times.
author: Leah S.

description:
The 500 Club is a classic! I had a excellent birthday party here once that ended with a crawl through a human spanking machine... so awesome!

Beware of the bathroom... I know two babies conceived in there...
author: Kelly B.

description:
Oh, sh*t! What happened last night?!? 
Photo booth: hop in, snap a Polaroid. It will make it a little easier the next day remembering what happened after one-too-many PBR's.

You might also notice that your clothes don't match. Guess I didn't get the memo that green mini skirts, black tights and brown shoes were the hot new thing. Hey, if the guy next to you at the bar is diggin' it and buying you drinks, go you!

It ain't classy, it ain't pretty, no fancy drinks here. get your beer on and line up a few on the jukebox. It's not my scene, but there's nothing to knock about this place.
author: Alissa A.

description:
Finally made it to this spot again.  I seem to recall being in there in the morning years ago and this time it seemed much clearer and cleaner inside - but then again maybe that was me.

Either way I like the non-smoking factor of most places in SF and the 500 Club bartenders are solid so it's a nice spot especially b/c of the booths and sit down video gaming.
author: Gene X.

description: Great bar to watch the giants, always a crowd, they've always got beer and food close by.... it's a good bar.
author: Caitlin F.

description:
The presence of 275 reviews before me says it all - this dive bar is popular.
It's only 5 pm on a Saturday night but the place is already packed, although with its size, it doesn't take much to fill it to capacity.

I find my friend, and got a bonus extra friend in the rendezvous bargain, and we're greeted enthusiastically like old timers...even though I don't know him. A couple hipster scene-sters at nearby booths pooh-poohed the noise we made, but whatev. 

The ambiance is mellow and cool. I'm envious.
author: Lemonjelly L.

description: Coffee in the mission after 10PM is oddly not available. On a whim we hopped into the 500 Club on the off chance they had some. They did. Although I'm supposed to warn that it's BYOS - which means bring your own splenda, sugar, or spoon. :)
author: Regine W.

description:
Update: I want to take something back. The 500 Club still has it going on! I had a lovely time there last night, plus one star.
...................

The 500 Club used to stay open all night on weekends. You couldn't buy booze from 2-6am, but you could play pool and chill with your DTs until it was morning and you could booze it up again. Great for sleepless old timers, post show drag queens, bar workers, clubbers, and speed freaks. Good times! Now it just seems like any bar anywhere. Nice people work there. Neighborhoody vibe.
author: J. R.

description: 500 Club is badass. Nothin more needs to be said
author: Nick R.

description:
The 500 Club is a quintessential Mission dive bar. Get Tecate & Pabst in the can for cheap (I think it was $2.50) or step up to a quality beer from the tap --- such as Speakeasy. They have a full bar that is good as well.

All walks of life frequent this bar: Mission hipsters, leather bikers, the cleaner cut sports fans, guys, chicks, straight, gay, etc. I love the fireplace on cold, foggy, summer nights. The age range is also varied, from twenty-something to mid forties.

I've lived in the Mission for 5 years and as 16th street gets busier, this bar has become more and more popular. Sometimes the place is so packed you can't get a seat whereas before it was never difficult.

Parking here is difficult if not impossible. Take public transit or, if you must drive, park at the Hoff garage (at 16th).
author: Alan L.

description:
great vibe, pseudo divey, good place to meet for drinks or watch a giants game.

too much karoake and frequently out of stock on some pretty fundamental liquors/liqueurs, but that just means they're busy!
author: alexander b.

description:
Nice place to meet up with friends and shoot the merde for a while.  Cool patrons, a few notches up the hipster scale from the run-of-the-mill mission bar, but still not a scene.  The dogs were cool until they started barking at each other.  

In sum:
If you're that cute girl with the bangs that kind of looks like Anna Karina that my friend spilled a little beer on, I am SO sorry, and thank you for not sicking your dog named after Rufus Wainwright on us.
author: James M.

description:
I was surprised by how many bar-goers there are at this place on Saturday at 3pm...!

Super-divey. 

Bathroom is sketchy; but at least there is one!
author: Misha F.

description:
I noticed the smell first. I thought about the stuff I may have been stepping on and quickly jumped on a bar stool.
Cheap dive bar with all the fixing's. I'd drink here again and again!
author: Kim S.

description:
So this bar is cool, totally hiptastic, has booths, a jukebox, slightly grungy, serves alcohol, etc.

But the best part is the resident soccer goalie dog that will beat you every time. 

You cannot get a tennis ball past this pooch. You kick it low and hard, you try to meg it, you bounce it off the side of the wall, you and a friend pass back and forth before chipping it over its back...no dice. You will be schooled over and over again. 

For a former college soccer player, the experience can be quite humbling...and equally as entertaining. 

Dogs & beer. Yay mission.
author: Kelly R.

description:
I was walking around the area after leaving Dolores Park. It was one of those muggy summer days, so I started developing a thirst. Maybe it was the huge sign or the welcoming wide-open doors but I had an urge to step inside. 

Don't regret it one bit. It's a damn nice dive bar. Not disgustingly grungy, plenty of TVs to pick and choose from, a jukebox that has an amazing selection (alternative/punk, that's a first!) and cheap drinks. 

Nice enough for me to sit down and have a few drinks and read Kafka and watch baseball. 

I'd go back, definitely.
author: Danilo D.

description:
Update based on recent experience here:  It think this bar would actually smell better if they allowed smoking.  Really.

Previous review:

1:55am.  Dude behind bar pulls out megaphone.

 "You have 5 minutes to finish your alcoholic beverages".  

That is definitely worth some bonus stars.  Well, maybe just one bonus star.
author: Ken and Yuri Q.

description:
Hands down the best spot for pick-up hetero-dude vs. lesbo arm wrestling that I've found in the city. Oh, and Miller High Life on tap. 

(Special note for pin-ball connoisseurs: hitting the bonus on the Playboy machine drops a trap door to reveal a nice set of '70 boobies.)
author: Brian S.

description:
This bar is one of my favorite bars in the mission.  Although it looks like a dive bar, it's very relaxing, the bartenders don't have attitude, although the beer selection is solid and cheap.  They have shiner bock on draft for $3, which is really nice.

Also, the area behind the bar is really relaxing and is more spacious than the rest of the bar.  The bar rarely feels crowded overall.  Plus, there's an old style photo booth back there.
author: Jeff A.

description:
I have been told a lot of things about the 500 Club.  I have been told that, Friday, during an impromptu pub crawl involving me, my brother and his wife, and 2 of their friends, I led the group here.  I remember happy hour at Chaya, where I had about 6 drinks and left feeling good.  I remember dinner at Tokyo Go Go, where Wifey, me, my brother and his wife split a bottle of sake.  I remember Wifey leaving us after dinner, because she had to work the next morning.  I remember going to Elixir, and having a few more drinks there, which is when my brother's 2 friends joined us.  I remember going to The Phoenix in search of food, only to be told that their kitchen closes at 11 (admittedly, it was later than 11).  I remember portions of our meal at Taqueria La Cumbre, where I engaged in a burrito-eating contest with my brother (the challenge consisted of eating exactly 1 burrito).  I have been told that, after the burrito challenge concluded in my favor, my brother and I engaged in a college-educated-white-boy battle rap throw down, wherein I apparently performed well enough to achieve Living Legend status in the eyes of my brothers friends.

These things, I remember (save for the battle rap).  I have no reason to dispute the notion that we also went to the 500 Club.  I remember wanting to go.  I realize that it is located geographically between Elixir and The Phoenix.  I have vague recollections of a bar decked out all in red.  But not...exactly what one would call memories.  I have been told that, shortly after arriving at the 500 Club, my brother and I began loudly calling for Jaeger Bombs, a drink that I actually abhor.  Thankfully, the bartenders knew better than to accede to our demands.  Apparently.  I have been told that my brother and I stood in the middle of the bar, with our arms wrapped around each other, deep in private conversation.  I remember snippets of conversation with my brother, including at least one bit of fascinating information that I remember clear as day.  But I can't say that I wholly remember the 500 Club.  Although, if their bartenders cut my brother and I off, as I'm told they did, then I salute the place.

Some people, maybe even many people, perhaps even most people, would consider this entire episode something to be ashamed of.  But those people still have a healthy dose of self-respect, and I lost my last vestiges of that years ago.  Makes for funnier stories.  And the occasional formal, written apology letter or court summons.

While my memory of the 500 Club may be fuzzy, and rounded at the edges, my memories of Saturday morning are sharp and distinct.  And while I may not remember everything I should about the 500 Club, I remember enough to be glad that my discussions with my brother didn't cause me to lead the group to the Elbo Room.  I make a lot of mistakes (midnight burrito with extra-hot sauce???  What was I thinking??), but there's a line between excess and the intentional infliction of injury.  The 500 Club was safely on the correct side of that line.
author: Ben P.

description: This is my second favorite bar in the city.  And... the first bar I ever stepped foot in when I was only 17!!  Great place to play pool and listen to great music.  Beware of Howard playing pool - he's a shark.  ;)
author: Stephanie R.

description:
As dives go this is definitely one of them. Sunday afternoon not much open want to just sit grab a drink and sit in the booths and people watch.

It is in the style of a shot and chaser bar, whom ever is welcome just plop your cash down after you order or the bar frau gets a little edgy.
author: tery c.

description:
It had been years since I've been to the 500 Club, so I was kind of stoked that my friend suggested we meet here for a beer and catch up.  

I love the laid-back 'tude, but I kind of didn't like how the doggy kept nuzzling against my thigh.  Each time it happened it surprised me and I jumped a little.  I think I'm a bit anxious.
author: Marcus C.

description: i went to the 500 Club for just a beer. Parking was easy so that was awesome. I got a Blue Moon for $4, pretty good. It smelled like a dirty bar, but hey it was. I liked the location. ITS ONLY CASH, and the ATM machine charges you $3, warning. The bartender was nice and cute, can't complain about the service. I wish there was more seating
author: alexandria g.

description:
On my first visit to 500 Club, one of the girls in our drinking party barely managed to stop her bag from getting stolen, I was nearly run down by a group of sorority girls singing "Jesse's Girl," someone spilled their drink on my shoes and in 2 hours, I could only actually get a drink from the bar twice.

Sure, the jukebox had some killer tunes at times and the bartenders (when I actually saw them) were pretty cool, but with bars, it's the clientelle who make or break an experience. They need to put a new bouncer on duty who won't let in the irritating folks.
author: Jere K.

description: Friendly local dive. People are approachable, drinks are cheap. Photo booth is a nice touch.
author: Mandy H.

description: This is a good bar with good prices ($3 for a bottle of Shiner Bock), a mixed crowd (good hipster-to-not-hipster ratio, esp for the Mission), and it's not too loud, but they play good music (a little 80's sprinkled in here and there). Fun. One issue was that somebody brought their midsized dog, which randomly attacked my friend to the point he was bleeding and the owner gave my friend a dirty look.
author: Andrew K.

description:
I used to live in the Mission and frequently scouted out new bars to explore. One of which was NEVER the 500 club, mostly because of the discouraging sign "open at 10am daily" and  because it looked like a place I might run into old guys in plaid shirts and dirty fingernails who are awoken by the bartender who have called them cabs.

With that said, (and maybe because it was a Saturday night) the place was surprisingly hoppin'. It was very mission which is appropriate considering it's location... The drinks were STRONG, pretty damn cheap, there is a pool table, a photo booth and free bbq's on sunday mornings. I never thought I'd say it, but i'd go back!

4 stars for the skanky looking 500 club. Don't judge a bar by it's facade I suppose....
author: Molly W.

description:
It is amazing that a "dive bar" that my father entertained himself in decades ago is now a cool hip place.
A bunch of twits who think they are being alternative,please go back to all the other  bars in the Mission that cater to your drivel and leave one place for those of us who just want a fricking drink, where wearing a Tshirt and shorts and being on a bicycle does not make you one of the up abd coming hipster wanna be"s.
author: Guiseppe B.

description:
This joint should be called the .500 Club.


 That's my blood alcohol level every time I walk out of here.


 Seriously, the bartenders here don't know when to cut you off. That, or I'm a pretty lucid drunk and just fool 'em. Either way, the folks here know how to get me boozed up, and for cheap!


 And quite frankly, I have to be seriously hammered to tolerate the Mission on a Friday or Saturday night.


 The 500 Club, as with any other bar in a hip, trendy area, is awesome on a weeknight. Come the weekend, all bets are off. But don't worry - should you choose to come out on amateur night, there'll be enough $2 beer and $4 cocktails to ensure you won't remember it.


 Actually, come to think of it, the last thing I do remember is singing along loudly to Whitesnake. I think it might be time to admit I have a problem.
author: Omid T.

description:
I've copy-pasted my old review except for excising a section about a pool table. For some reason, 500 club, like many a mission bar, have decided pool is out and more seats are in. I like pool, but seats probably make more money. The rest of the review still stands.

This a bar that has gotten so dive-y that it almost comes back around to pretension, in a good way. Beer is excellent, crowd is awesome. The people that come are never too hip or too prep. We take ourselves so lightly that it almost comes back around to seriousness.

And play the video game machine near the back. Pornographic 'spot the difference' and word searches are always fun.
author: Ryan R.

description:
It's dark in here. They have awesome big, red booths to chill at, a good beer selection, and descent bloody marys.
 
I've only been here during the day.  It's a great place for afternoon drinks, so I'm not sure about the "nightlife" element of it.  

They used to open at 6am, now the sign includes a tiny, hard to read: "not" open at 6am.

still a decent place, tho.
author: Shayna N.

description:
The unhipster place on Guerrero......

dive, dark, and somewhat seedy; local neighborhood crowd. Pool table, cheap drinks and cool bartenders.  Good if you wanna grab a drink with your boys; might not be the best pace to impress chicks.
author: Summit S.

description:
SURPRISE! A bar in San Francisco with a crappy bathroom. Not quite Irvine Welsh levels, but a soggy floor nonetheless. And what's with the graffiti? Are the hipsters going gangsta'?

Drinks were decent and reasonable. One of the bartenders was chatting with a customer whilst I was ready to order, but it was only about a 30 second wait.

Jukebox had a decent selection and thank god it wasn't digital but it seemed to skip random song selections.

All in all a 3-star time.
author: Jeremy P.

description:
At what point is a bar not really worthy of the "dive" title? Don't get me wrong, the place sure looks like one, especially during happy hour when there was an ecclectic crowd and mutts roaming around. Beer was cheap and it was just what I was looking for after work: a quick beer or 2 at a place I could go in jeans and a t-shirt. Then I returned Friday night around 11pm and the place was packed. Doesn't a dive bar, by definition, not draw large crowds? I've seen enough Mission folk drinking PBR bottles for a while...

5 stars from 5-7pm and 2 stars when it becomes cool to be here.
author: Jennie H.

description: To the kids who reviewed and thought 500 Club was an actual club: you should have done your research before you showed up at the door. Because 500 is a dive bar--excuse me--awesome dive bar. Yeah it's a little crowded and maybe not the cleanest spot, but it is what it is. Nonetheless, the bartenders are quick, the drinks are cheap, and the music is always good. A great place to mingle (esp if you snag a booth), drink on budget and talk to complete strangers.
author: Alex H.

description:
Major dive appeal, a pool table, jukebox, and an an AMAZING polaroid (photo booth-esque) machine. Any photobooth fan will fall in love with the machine that allows you to take 4 photo's and place them on 1 polaroid.

Don't mind the cracked out girl in the corner, she's just trying to have a good time.
author: Chris I.

description:
Love this bar!  I've been here a few times.  The first time was on a weeknight on a date.  Perfect atmosphere to get to know someone because it wasn't too crowded but not romantic by any means.

Second time with my friends on a Saturday night after a concert of my friend's band.  We were kind of being "bandaids"

Its got good music, good people, cheap drinks.  Can't ask for more than that.
author: Angela S.

description:
Racer 5 and Magners 
two of my favs 
and theyve added hardwood floors - yes
80's music on the jukebox - Yes
Magners at a non-irish bar - Yes
Big Booths that you can get cozy in (even though I have no one to be cozy with ) -Yes
Fireplace (for when its cold not now) - Yes
Open early in the day -Yes
Even though we went with a guy who latched on and appeared to be a total tweaker (thats what we get for going to Zeitgeist too early) we still had a good time
such a good time that I had to go home and take a nap
but not before horrifying Andy and Russ at Cheiftan 
I will be back this weekend
and thanks to the cute guy with the fedora for helping me see what was on the jukebox (I wasnt wearing my glasses)
author: maryanncolby

description:
I went here to meet some people that lived in the mission.  I'd say it's like any other bar I've been to.  I mean, I don't know I try and stay fun and positive and look for things that differentiate bars, but I really couldn't tell the difference.  There's only so much variance I suppose. 

Anyway, they had all the requisite beers.  It's FULL of people on a Saturday night, and most everyone's drunk.  Eyes wandering around, pretty typical SF.  I like it for the change in environment.  If you like standing room only and a jukebox, hey, this might be your bar.
author: Amir B.

description:
Happy Birthday to me! Blue Ribbon Please! 
Loved everything about this place from the hippity-hoppity locale to the people inside, the crap on the walls and colors of everything. 
The best vibe I have ever gotten at a bar. Everyone was just so friendly, maybe my shirt was a little low cut that day? lol I do not recall but I felt welcomed here by the employees and other drunks. Some may say this is a hipster hang out but I don't like to classify people sort to speak. I just thought everyone looked so fashionable but gave the impression that they didn't try to attain this look. There was a Ms. Pacman table top, over-priced photo booth, plenty of cozy areas, a big bar to find a stool at and good music bumping. I noticed the two times I hung out here on my weekend visit to Frisco that this place is pretty jumping and has super mega drink specials. Check it out if you're in the area. This place and a few other in walking distance have me planning to move to the area because it was so freaking awesome!
author: Alison B.

description: Cheap drinks, great divey atmosphere, comfy booths.
author: Mark A.

description:
So I drive past this place to work for 6 months and figure, hey if I quit work  I can always go to the 500 club and start drinking at 6:00am! What a perfect dive bar.

Then once i quit I found out they dont actually open then. Not even close, its padlocked at 9am. Still a quality "dive" bar. Just not quite as divey as I might like.
author: Tony D.

description: Five stars for watching Packers games at 10 am on Sunday mornings, three stars for the rest of the time. The crowd is on the weird side of eclectic. The karaoke is gleefully shameless and painful.
author: Adam Z.

description: Cheap beers, nice bartenders and awesome jukebox. Not much more you could ask for in a Mission dive bar. Also you can order Clare's Deli now, so grab a sandwich and hit the photobooth. The crowd is diverse so there isn't a lot of ironic fashion to send you into a homicidal rage.
author: Beth D.

description:
Enh, an ok bar.
I tend to only come here when I'm meeting a friend who wants to come here. Its always busy.
author: Tom S.

description: 500 Club, I wanted to like you. You came at a high recommendation from my friends, your bouncer was really nice, your music was entertaining, but your bartender was a fucking asshole. I ordered a Tom Collins and the guy flips the fuck out because he was out of soda water. Slams some glasses around and gets dragged into the back by the other bartender and his bar back. Don't know if I'll come back here again.
author: John E.

description:
My favorite divey bar in the Mission, and I live here. Great juke box, too.

Really, that says it all.

Oh, and get there early if you want a table. 

Oh, and in the winter they have fires in the fireplace, and they allow dogs.
author: Jen B.

description:
Good cheap drinks that are good for your soul.
Meh. Maybe not for your soul. But their margaritas are cheap and good. Booths comfortable. The place is dog friendly. Woof!
...However, they have TV's, but during the giants season, i don't mind so much. The staff is attentive with no or little 'tude. And I always seem to strike an easy conversation there. Plus a billiard table. Jeez, i am on a roll aren't I??? Hence the count'em - five easy stars.On the weekends, i understand they have some sort of BBQ, but i have not tried that though. I good juke with dinosaur jr. and the runaways, hell's yeah!
author: wayne s.

description:
I have been to this bar many times, one of those places where everyone is excited because "we're going to a dive!"  However, the idea of slumming it at a dive is far better than the result.

The last time I went there, I was talking with my fellow preppy-ish looking friend (I wouldn't call myself preppy but I do enjoy the comfort of a sweater when I go out, which doesn't exactly make me look like I belong at a dive bar), when a guy walks up to us, opens up a switchblade and says, "this is my knife, do you guys like it" and then walked away, two seconds after which I told my friend, "well, you can stay but I'm leaving".  Haven't been back since, as I pictured that knife entering my stomach and it was not pleasant.
author: P. G.

description:
I love living on the same street as the 500. When I first moved to San Francisco it was such a beacon of homeliness for me! I could be walking from anywhere in town and within a few blocks of home know I was near home (i.e. I didn't know I was near home before being within a few blocks of home) by seeing the sign!

The clientelle is varied - its interesting that this place attracts the marina crowd that are a bit cooler than the usual marina crowd. I love the layout of the bar area, often choosing to sit around the back of the bar. 

I stop in about once or twice a week to get a beer on the way home. I drink beer alone a lot. I think i may be an alky. hmm.
author: mike o.

description:
The 5 brings back all the memories I haven't forgotten yet. You are a true gem. 

BTW: The 500 Club may have the best photo booth in the city. No matter how wasted I am, that damn thing manages to make me more attractive.
author: Courtney I.

description:
Best dive bar in SF bar none (if you will excuse the pun). 
The drinks are strong (non of the watered down vodka you will find at other places) and the jukebox has one of the best selections around, all be it limited. Although on a busy night, you may be thrown out after last call before your selection is chosen. The crowd is just that perfect mix of mission meets noe valley and the best of both. Non-pretentious and easy going. Plus not bad for larger groups either, the back room near the pool table is great for an after dinner hang out, nothing too huge but if you get there earlier you will have lots of room for a crowd of 10 or so. 

Not that it needs another great review but i love this dive bar so much that I had to chip in and make it the first bar i reviewed on yelp. Expect many more, drinking is a hobby, a curse, built into my irish genes, the essence of life.....etc
author: Ronan O.

description:
Last time I was here it was my 21st birthday. I was totally obliterated and loving every moment of it. I remember seeing dogs inside the bar and a good mix of ages. Dive bars are my favorite and I think this one really fits the mold.
