I cant really go into too much detail because I don't really remember a lot from that night. But I can tell you that the drinks come fast and conversation is always fun. Yet, it was kind of cramped and the dogs seemed a bit nerous with so many people around... Other wise pretty great.
author: Katy D.

description:
In town from NYC...I'm a pretty serious regular of dive bars best suited for wasting beautiful days at...

It was a beautiful day in SF...but did I love 500 club. While I kept to myself, the din of the regulars were enough to make me feel at home. 

Lots of love in this place. Anyone who love Welcome to the Johnstons in NYC (before 9pm that is) - appreciate the similar vibe.
author: andrew r.

description:
Awesome dive bar.

Started my mission crawl here, and as my first attempt at drinking in the mission, this was a great way to start off. Sat in the corner at the galatica table machine, the jet black school chair and the fire place. Awesome atmosphere, people, and drinks. Very divey and thats the way it should be. The place is a shinning beacon of dive bars, or was it just the awesome neon sign..
author: Charles C.

description:
The 500 reminds me of the place I frequented while living in a small town in Montana. I really dig bars with a comfortable feel, good group of regulars and amiable staff. As far as I can tell, 500 Club meets all those requirements. Plus, it's got a great sign. 

I first went there to meet up with a birthday party but the group wasn't there running late. So, as a single, I found a place at the bar and in no time was engrossed in conversation with the regulars who were generous with the drinks and easy to hang out with. If you're looking for a chill and entertaining scene, hit up 500.
author: Marita M.

description:
It's a good, off the main street, sort of bar.

It's easy to get drunk here if you're into liquor, unfortunately somebody else probably already beat you to it and their group of friends are so drunk, they're going to make your visit uncomfortable.
author: Henry C.

description:
This review is for the bartender with long hair and glasses only.  l love the 500 club and after 11 years of gettin' drinks there, with amazing service at affordable prices, I am really disappointed. After having several cocktails there last night. (and tipping generously, I might add; $5.00 on two Miller Lites in one incidence) when I ordered a water this bartender (with the long hair and glasses) posed for his friends and pretended to pour Vodka in it. I saw him do it and asked 'Did you just pour vodka in my water?' he said 'no, I just pretended to.' 'You just pretended to!?' I asked. He said 'yeah.' 
I'm sorry, but if you want to 'fake pretend' that you are intoxicating some girl without her knowledge to get laughs from your friends, at least have the courtesy to reserve it for your Frat House and not a place of business. Yuck. As a bartender you are entusted with the health and safety of your patrons and that trust is not an opportunity for you to be cavalier. You're a creep.
author: Rita E.

description:
I was waiting for this wicked retarded guy I know at the 500 Club the other night and so many Yelp related memories started flooding back into my mind of times spent there:

-When Matt H. climbed on a mailbox outside the 500 and fell off it (or, as he says "Failed to fly off it") after drinking to-kill-ya at the Yelp Elite event at Air in Oakland all afternoon.
-The first time I ever met KayJay AND Stormy in person.
-The first time I ever made out with a Yelper was outside the 500  (thank god I gave that shit up for lent, yo.)
-The fact that an unnamed Yelper told me that they were taken away from the 500 Club twice by ambulance to prove to me that they're a professional drinker... yah, um... funny scary?
-There were some questionable pictures being taken of me making out INSIDE the 500 with another unnamed Yelper.
-Edubs took my FAVORITE picture of me ever at the 500 Club: http://www.facebook.com/photo.php?pid=214075&id=527200338
-When Drue C. and I cried and held each other in the back booth telling each other how much we loved each other after drinking to-kill-ya all afternoon at the same aforementioned Yelp Elite event that we then got into a fight afterwards.
-Having peed in an alley with Lisa Wiz and Drue C. in transit between the 500 and Kilowatt, only to be busted by someone coming home and opening their garage door.
-Many bacon dog expeditions originated at the 500.

The rest of the memories are a little fuzzy, to be truthful.

Fact is: I still love this bar, even though I don't DYL anymore (does anyone) and rarely see most of my Yelp friends.  This particular evening I had such a good time with the wicked retarded guy I was waiting for while I thought of these (and, texted a few of you about them) that I went back the following friday with my former FWB (who was introduced to me by a Yelper) AND went back there this past Sunday with the wicked retarded guy I was waiting for at the beginning of the story.

Yay, 500.  You rock.  Plus your drinks are cheap and powerful.
author: Kate R.

description:
Avoid it on weekend evenings.

Go on weeknights for a beer and a bump.

Make sure your Pabst isn't frozen when they give it to you.  This is a minor complaint since it's usually deliciously ice cold... I'll gladly suffer the rare slushy beer for that.

Make sure you're more intoxicated than the bartender.
author: Peter L.

description: A fun, award-winning dive bar with good space and character. I could easily see this being my favorite hangout if I lived nearby. Space is laid out well on both sides of the bar, with bench and booth seating available. Photos of (presumably) regulars line the walls, along with the aforementioned awards from newspapers and guidebooks. A video-game table and photobooth are tucked away in the back, while the very cool jukebox stands next to the door. Both pounding and mellow selections from a wide variety of genres are available, which makes for an interestingly eclectic playlist. On the plus side, that means that if you experience the "7-minute lull" in a conversation, you can easily comment on the odd change in music to get things going again!
author: Bill B.

description:
Definitely a DIVE!, but well worth the money. Can't beat Happy Hour, at least not on the day i was there last week. Got my pints of Boont Amber Ale for 3 bucks a piece, and the time b4, Belvedere on the rocks 5  bucks.
My kind of dive
author: Brian F.

description: Really good top shelf margaritas made with Patron. This is a good, convenient place for happy hour. I have no cute or memorable story about this place and I would not say this is my favorite dive bar but I can see myself stopping in again for another almost purely alcoholic margarita.
author: Lisa J.

description: This is always the place to go at 1:23 a.m. when you need one more glass of booze to quench the grinding loneliness, and you've slept with most of the bartenders so they have to serve you.  A right fine place to stagger around in hoping that this time, you're gonna find 'The One' and not some alcoholic grease-ape who will leave you with nothing but a a taste of salt in your mouth and a sore asshole.  Not that I speak from personal experience or anything.  Be sure to lick the tables for a cheap cocaine high.
author: Eggs M.

description: Good dive bar, short walk from Dolores Park.
author: Lara C.

description: 500 Club feels lived in.  It feels dingy and worn.  I love it.  I want a bar where I can grab a seat with my friends and get progressively louder as the night goes on.  And that's exactly what I get here.  Don't forget to get there early to snag a booth - otherwise you'll be standing all night long.
author: Kathryn G.

description:
If you have the mildest case of OCD, I would suggest that you steer clear of this joint.  When a friend of mine recently had a birthday gathering here, I eagerly RSVPed yes.  I love cool signs, and to me its usually the indicator of a cool place.  Not so much.  I was expecting a dive bar, which I occasionally like from time to time, but I just found this place to be disgusting.  Absolutely disgusting.  Mangly mutts walking roaming around without leashes sniffing random people.  Remnants of take out food littering the counter and various table.  Several wet spots on the floor.  Who knows if it's a spilled drink or dog piss?  Then it took about 5 minutes to get my Budweiser so it gave me plenty of time to watch the bartender in motion.  Looks like they're famous for their Bloody Marys, which is quite the labor intensive drink.  The bartender laid out an arrangement of green beans and peppers on the bar countertop, which was on the grimy side.  God knows when it was washed last.  Then he managed to drop a bean on the floor, which he picked up and used in the drink he was making.  Yuck.

500 Club has an average of 4 star reviews so I'm clearly not in the majority with my review, but whatever.  Rock bottom happy prices are the only reason to come back.  Well for other people.  I would never set foot in there again.
author: Amy Z.

description: I like it that this place always has a different personality. The atmosphere of grandpas basement never changes, but the people coming and going do, and it keeps it interesting. I also like the reliability that around 12:30 this place usually has more happy drunks than your average bar. Keep it up.
author: Sean Q.

description: If you want to get arrested twice in one 24 hour period you should kick it here.  Whycome I get two "get me out of jail" calls spaced 8 hours apart?  All I know is the story starts with "I was at the 500 Club" and continues with "so I went back to the 500 Club".   Swurr.
author: Mokirobinson M.

description: Great place if you love dive bars like I do.  Cheap Strong Drinks. The bartender was awesome and the other people in the place were really friendly which made being there so much fun!
author: Olivia T.

description: I don't know if it counts as a dive bar at this point since the inside was classy enough, but I did end up with a bruise on my knee and forehead simply by falling down outside hailing a taxi, so in my book, forehead hailing taxi bruises means they served you well and plenty which is the hallmark of dive bars the world over....
author: Mason G.

description: My friend and I used to say that Bender's was our first home, 500 was our second home and our actual home was our third home.  Yup the 5, as we like to call it has indeed become a home away from home.  I just get this nice warm fuzzy feeling whenever I go there and the bartenders are the best! So attentive and loving, I just want to give them all big bear hugs till their guts pop out - now that's love!  And now, after replacing that nasty funky carpet it's even better cause I no longer want to barf after a long night of drinking with my friends at the 5.
author: Frigga G.

description: The 500 Club won "Best Dive Bar" in The Guardian's Best Of The Bay 2008 series. It won for a reason. It is a classic dive bar. Small, stinky, beer and whiskey a plenty. My favorite part is their booths. Get there early and snag a booth if you've got 5-ish people.
author: Ali R.

description: If you flash the Saturday bartender, you have a 50% chance of getting all of your tips back.
author: Katelin H.

description: Once a fellow patron unbuttoned his pants and flopped his flaccid genitals onto my table while I was drinking my vodka-tonic.  They also serve free popcorn.
author: Tamara B.

description: This place is fun, intimate and they have cheap good drinks! It is off the beaten path a little but not too far off, so it's worth going to and I will go back for a laid back night.
author: Karen T.

description: OK, it definitely smells in here (a weird musty scent), but if you like your dive bars to be really dive-y, then this is the place for you! The drinks are cheap, the atmosphere is dark and dingy, and nobody gives a crap who else is hanging out in there. Like me - a tall, blond, tweed-wearing Russian Hill-ite - who nobody looked at twice for being out of place. Loved it!
author: Ava S.

description: This place is totally unique in our experience of dives (which admittedly isn't huge).  The tattooed lady is worth the price of admission (she pours mean drinks too).  And the laid back, hang around in the next room, karaoke action was great.  Impromptu group sing along, more like!  Too bad we are aging hipsters and kind of stick out...still no bad vibes, no age-ism.
author: Thelma Lee G.

description: Every single time I go here something crazy happens to me, some good, some bad, and I continue to go back.  I seriously believe this place has some secret voodoo going on.  If you believe in that kind of thing, check it out and let me know what happens to YOU.  Bloodies may rival those at Zeitgeist, which is a serious compliment.
author: Claire C.

description: Classic dive bar with Vegas cheesy flair! What more could you want? Drink prices are more like that of Reno and the crowd is always fun, especially daytime after Dolores Park outings. P.S. I just read a review of this place being difficult to navigate? How difficult is it to navigate a small dive bar? You suck at life if you need help with that.
author: Deseray T.

description:
minus one star bc the photo booth was broken sunday.  that is just not acceptable.  the photobooth and i have a longstanding friendship that needs to be honored.  photobooth, i am disappointed in you!!

seriously though, the 500 club is the quintessence of what a neighborhood bar should be.  

i can *rolllllll* off my front porch and end up there in 3 minutes time, there is a photobooth, there is olaf the bartender, and there is a pool table.  now, i don't actually play pool (freshman year of college and various unfortunate events involving the table though not the sport being responsible), but every time i come, i manage to have at least one engaging conversation about how i don't play pool.

i also manage to not remember any other engaging conversation i ever may have had there.  that's a good thing--olaf does his job well :).  what baffles me is how this little mission dive is a destination bar for peeps citywide.  ok, maybe i get it bc i know even after i move, i'll be back.  soon, and often.
author: Roshni R.

description: This seems to be the Mission (??) equivalent on Rudy's in Hell's Kitchen.  A refreshing  breath of stinky, dive-bar air in a rapidly gentrifying neighborhood.  Though, based on the sign, it seemed a bit more like a breath of Vegas. Lured by tales of $3 flavored vodka drinks a few intrepid members of Team CM wandered in on a Monday night, and while the drinks weren't disappointing (not to mention mind-bogglingly cheap), unlike Rudy's the place seemed a bit too aware of its own kitcsch factor to be really welcoming.  I skipped the flavored vodka and went for my usual dirty vodka martini, which got me a brief look of confusion (judgment?) from the bartender.  It was fine.  The real discovery of the night (on my part anyway) was this lovely bi-colored drink called a Snake Bite consisting of Guiness and Pear Cider.  Who knew?
author: Sam P.

description: If you love hanging with the hardcore alcoholics -- the ones who are already starting at 8am, then this is the place for you.  But I find it smelly, over-priced, not so clean, and just run-down.  But it's certainly a place where you can hide and drink yourself to oblivion.
author: Kris A.

description:
I can't tell if the smell of shit is coming from the carpet, overflowing toilet or the bartender.

The sign is the best part. No need to go in.
author: nic d.

description: I have yet to leave sober from the 500 Club, shots can make a nice girl do just about anything! Sometimes the hipster posers can be a downer but order a Bud Bottle and you'll fit right in.
author: April M.

description: When I moved here in 1998, this was my second home. Even though they now have carpeting, I still enjoying all the characters who frequent this place. If you're with a group, try scoring one of their booths for maximum drinking and people-watching pleasure.
author: Nish N.

description: I went to the emergency room at Kaiser one night and the doctor who saw me tried to pick me up by saying he frequented the 500 club. It didn't work, but I always wonder if I'll run into him there, chugging PBR's.
author: Maria D.

description: Cool spot, fair prices, good vibe. It's a nice place to get drunk in the mission area.
author: K C.

description: Liking this dingy dark place, where the bartenders give generous pours and even a free drink now and then, especially if you buy a t-shirt from here.  Hating the old man with the long white beard kicking my ass x 3 in pool.  Wutta hustler!  BUT loving the photo booth here.  Good, that I, for once, actually came out kinda decent using one of these thingamabobbies.  Bad that I lost the picture.  Lemme know if anyone finds it somewhere in there.
author: Joyhan S.

description: good place to grab a drink and watch the game, seating is plentiful but its way too hard to get a drink at the bar. unless you have a penis. then apparently it is easy. i think i waited nearly 20 mins. while my male friend got served instantly....twice! the crowd is mixed but everyone seemed pretty chill and they have a jukebox. its not a favorite of mine but atleast they have booths.
author: M K.

description:
200 less than the 700 club, 500 club is quickly becoming one of my favorite mission dives.  just slightly off the 16th & valencia corridor, 500 club is never as crowded as delerium or casanova, and yet, the drinks are better and cheaper.

just because we got accosted here once by a girl with only one shoe, is that a reason to avoid the place?  i say not.  in fact, maybe you need a little one shoed adventure.

and yes, i totally told that girl she would get hookworm from wearing only one shoe.  and she believed me. so there.
author: Steve S.

description: I went there once in 1996 when nobody went there anit was pretty divy and dead. Now that I live a few doors away i still can't stand the noise, the vomit covered sidewalks, the wafting smoke. What do those people do in there at all hours? Drink booze?
author: Tom H.

description: This bar reminds me of Portland, Oregon. It's divey, it has dark wood inside, and they offer Pabst for $2. If only they would let me put a $2 pbr on a credit card, and offered fries until 2 in the morning (thank you OLCC), than it would be like I never left Oregon. Otherwise, I like this bar. It's good place to hang out if you're young, single, and in the mission, and if you are looking for the kind of dirty (literally), unshaven fellas that I'm into.
author: Netty L.

description: In some ways, this place reminds me of Voda, cramped and aching for elbow room.  Yet it has the charm of the Page...a neighborhood watering hole.  Only an hour into DYL and I was on my 3rd Greyhound.  I guess they don't make them like they used to...or should.  Or maybe they do, and I was just enjoying it too much.  The drinks were cheap, so I'm not complaining...much.  The bartenders were especially good at taking care of your order.   I can't fathom trying to shoot pool here.  When it gets crowded, it's near impossible.
author: JeFF T.

description: Look up hole in the wall and you'll get the 500 Club clearly defined. This little neighborhood joint has a gritty look and grimy feel accessorized with a prominently placed pool table and quirky crowds all scattered about, involved in boisterous conversations that are all but drown-out by the jukebox. It's a puppy not a guard dog so don't let appearances fool ya, have a drink or two and chat with whoever you meet-you'll have a great time.
author: Jessica D.

description: I love this place. Cheap $5 Jameson and Gingers, fast service, great jukebox, and loose women. I often go there alone and always have a good time. No douche bags, some dirt bags, but no douches.
author: Spoke K.

description: Great watering hole, good rowdy crowds, occasional bar fights... Love the tunes and cheap drinks. If its not too crowded, you can play pool but usually have to poke people sitting at the bar.
author: Rachel L.

description:
I know there's 160 + reviews of this place (and counting) but I thought I'd throw in my reasons...

For one, you gotta love the crowd, whether it's one of the punkers, the guy letting his dog drink Prohibiton ale from his own glass, the old guy chugging beers at the end of the bar, the guy with an eyepatch dominating the pool table or the guy with the shitty attempt at the Flock of Seagulls hair, I love watching the people.  Add this to the stiff drinks and the good selection of beers on tap (Trummer Pils, Prohibition) and we've got ourselves a winner.  Did I mention you can get $2 bottled PBRs 24/7 (happy hour is every hour, bitch)?  There's an ATM next to the jukebox, making sure you don't have to go stumbling around the mission looking for one.
The pool table is pretty crowded but a fun choice, considering it seems you can get a game in without running into too many pros.  The pinball machine in back is decent, although the big draw there is that the bartenders are pretty polite about giving out quarters even if you don't order a drink.   The photobooth in the back is legendary although lately it seems to have a spotty record when it comes to consistent service.  Head down a few blocks to Mission and you can grab a late burrito at Taqueria Cancun.

There are a few minor cons, the most obvious being that this place can get ridiculously crowded in a hurry and getting to the bathroom after 11pm can be a task.  I haven't let these twart me yet from a visit to the 500.
author: Steven R.

description: This place does remind me of a place I used to do some underage drinking in my hometown...however, instead of authentic trailer trash as barmates, the 500 club has hipsters.  It can get crowded, so go to the back and stake out the fireplace.
author: Natalie M.

description:
what a sad bar.  40 somethings acting like 20 somethings..... and who even likes "rock-a-billy".   Hands down the least cool bar in the mission, if not san francisco.

please close.
author: Pammy S.

description: A laid back bar with a cool jukebox and $3 Shiner on tap.  What more do you need to know?
author: Joshua W.

description: Average bartending, and on occasion just plain rude and unpleasant. Other then that a pretty normal Mission dive-bar...maybe a little more pretense then average
author: Wilbur J.

description: Appropriate bar for the neighborhood.  Cool, apathetic crowd-  I think my favorite part of the bar though is the sign!  Should a dive have that big of a sign?  The drinks were cheap.  Tamale lady rolled through ($4 for one?, what, they got foie gras in 'em?).  There was a nice even ratio and everyone seemed to be having fun.  This is a place you don't mind getting dirty at.  It's a solid bar to drink.
author: Jake H.

description:
This is a pretty cool place to add to your Mission bar crawl.

Towards the back of the bar there is a "Pin the tale on the donkey" game, which is actually really fun when you're drunk. There is also one of those cool photo booths. Oh ya, and an old school Ms. PacMan video game table. 

Very reasonable prices - $3 PBR, $5 Redbull n' Vodka...

Nice bartender...mission hipster crowd.
author: Matt S.

description: Cool bartenders and cute guys...too many  f'ing wannabe hipsters to tolerate sober
author: Michelle G.

description: Fair priced drinks.  Good selection.  Friendly staff & patrons.  A place to sit (eventually).  Want something else, go somewhere else.
author: Rob H.

description: new fav bar!! dark, seedy, stiff drinks, tattoos, leather, rad music, my kinda place!!! Don't come if you wear business suits douche bags!
author: Amber F.

description: If you want a dive, you could do a whole lot worse.  Everyone knows the mission sucks on weekends, so don't go on a weekend.  If you decide you want mellow whiskey Sunday, or want to watch the end of a game, good place to go.  no frills, the way a bar should be.
author: Daniel H.

description: I always meet the coolest people here, the jukebox is a classic tool to bring me into longing nostalgia, and the bartenders are nice and divey. What more can a girl ask for?
author: Virginia J.

description: I celebrate the Sabbath by going to mass at the 500 club. I like to be there for the noon service cuz they have strong bloody mary's. AMEN.
author: santiago g.

description: Sticky bar that is hazardous to put your elbows on.  Egregious barstaff that treat you as though their dog just died.  Close quarters that remind you of the end scene in Crocodile Dundee (you know the last one where he walks on everyone's heads to get out of the train station?)  It's excellent.  Great people watching and a diverse crowd to make up fantastical stories about their lives.
author: Allison K.

description: Hipster heaven in the Mission.  Like Delirium, but with a cooler crowd and a better jukebox (you may hear PJ Harvey and White Snake within minutes of each other). It's still a neighborhood bar and thus manages to avoid the trendy feel of other dive-bar pretenders in SF.
author: Andrew E.

description:
i like this place.. in my head i try to imagine it back in the day.. it seems like it was the place to be... the booths look like they hold many sercrets...  ones i can only dream of.

it's not pretty, it's not a lounge..  it's a cool bar on guerrero.  and has become quite the spot in the last couple years...  the doorman was real cool..  i liked the bartender who was there a couple saturday afternoons ago..

haven't had a chance to get fondled in the photo booth yet...  

*note to self.. bring bf to the photo booth @ 500 club next time he's in town
author: Sheri N.

description: What a beautiful sign! A nice mission spot a tad off the beaten paths of Mission and Valencia. Dark and woody and just dirty enough. Went for a friday happy hour my first day in town. a good place to start a weekend of drinking. decent prices. nice booths.
author: Tim O.

description: You have the jukebox, you have the photo booth, you have the pool room, you have the bartenders saying something into a megaphone that you can't understand over the classic dive bar music.  I like that all sorts of people come here and mix together.  Go with a group of friends and have a good time.  You'll love this place if you have a craving for PBR's.
author: Tony P.

description: I dig this place.  Great beer on tap.  Super local vibe.  A bit noisy.  Last time I was there 4 girls came in and did a synchronized dance, in fishnets and with bright red lipstick, all smiles and oohs and ahhs, while their DJ leader announced their performance on a microphone.  Perhaps you've heard of them?  And this place really does open at 6am...in case you were wondering.
author: Abendigo R.

description: If you can get past the stench, they have a couple tv's, a fake fireplace, and enough beer and liquor to satisfy...
author: Nicolas H.

description: 4 stars for the polaroid photo booth and lighted sign alone!
author: Melissa C.

description: Somewhere in the hinterland between dive and douchey sits 500 Club - a sometimes-respite from Valencia St bar madness. Last time I was there, I was treated t a pretty solid extra dirty martini and bland but refreshingly un-pervy convo with a dude who works at the EPA.... No real complaints here.
author: christine h.

description: Everything but the dart board. Not sure what the best thing about this place is...the giant light up champagne glass sign? The photo booth? The red leather? The juke box? The drinks? I really like this little bar- so does my dog. She likes to play catch with the coasters.
author: Marianne s.

description: I got thrown out for ordering a cream soda the first time I went to the 500 club and I've been hanging there ever since. The crowd is mixed mission  dark second hand fashion with rockabilly biker tunnel breeders and generally non-violent for such a heavy drinking group. I know most of the bartenders and many of the regulars, so I go in most every trip to the city. It also helps that I have access to a studio a few doors down The 500 club is the kind of bar you can find all over the county - nothing fancy, just drinks, juke and laughs.
author: Wax W.

description: Reminds me like back home in NYC, like East Village/Williamsburg.
author: Julee K.

description: One of the finest dives in the city, no doubt. I have spent something close to the GDP of small third-world countries in the photobooth alone. If you're in the Mission, thirsty, & would rather not deal with the trendy bars crawling with hipsters, check the 500. A nice diverse crowd of unpretentious people many of whom take their drinking fairly seriously.
author: Pete J.

description: The 500 Club makes me misty eyed for when I first returned to San Francisco in the late '90s.  It was at the height of the dot.com boom, but here was this genuine, quintessentially San Franciscan dive bar crowd, totally oblivious to all of those annoying, nouveaux riches computer nerds.  Thank you, 500 Club.  You make San Francisco great.
author: KarenG P.

description: A perfect place to grab a brew on a lazy Sunday...hell...you can even come at 6am to start off the day.  Except for the nasty carpet (why carpet a bar?), the place is your typical Mission dive...
author: Mark D.

description: Love this place! It's a total dive bar that could be anywhere-USA, but that's part of the charm. Nothing really memorable sticks out in my mind, but I always seem to have a fun time when I go, so 4-stars for that!
author: Chris B.

description: Last time I was here a very old man claiming to be an alchemist asked me if I wanted to have sex. I declined (upon learning that he meant with him). He then told me the world was going to end at midnight that night and that he must go warn others. Anyway, I still like this place: relatively sceneless with stiff drinks, and a block from my place. What else could I ask for?
author: David K.

description: i really liked this place. love the sign: yes. love the big circular booths: yes. they have franzikaner (did i botch the spelling?: yes) on tap. fantastic! the beer is reasonable and the selection is good. the people watching was great and it was low key. it is a dive bar that has a reportedly gross bathroom (i held it) but has charm otherwise. it also allows dogs! :) it would be a regular place if i moved to the city for sure.
author: erika s.

description: The 500 Club gets an extra star for their awesome neon sign. Simply looking at it makes me feel festive, and it's easy to spot at a distance, even after a good number of drinks. Indeed if it wasn't for the sign this would just be another neighborhood dive bar. Albeit with nicer staff and better seating than a lot of places. So yeah, this is basically a review of the sign... but there are good drinks inside too!
author: Will A.

description:
The 500 Club is ground zero for Mission bars for me.  It's been there longer than most of them, and it will probably still be there long after most of them have gone.

Great neon sign in front.  Disregard the statement that it opens at 6am, because it doesn't any longer.

Inside, it's dark and stocked with a lot of hipsters, though there are seemingly always a few old fogie types that seem to lend the bar some credentials as a true dive bar.  I like the fact that the bar is accessible from two sides, which usually means being able to get a drink faster.  They usually have two bartenders on hand, which is also a good thing.   The bar itself has a good selection of midlevel type booze.  The drinks themselves don't stand out for being particularly any outstandingly good or bad quality, but at least they aren't expensive.

Sometimes they play good music on the jukebox and the place is dancing to the point where it almost resembles a club.  I also  hear that the Tamale Lady sometimes shows up here, but I've never seen her.  I am by no means a regular, though.  Just been there enough times to know what it's about.
author: Dave N.

description: The 500 Club is my new favourite bar. Yes, its favourite with a u, people, thats how special it is. It has random football club scarves on the wall (Norwich City? Are you too, a fan of Delia Smith?), a list of the usual suspects in the beer stakes, a great jukebox that I can bounce around to after a few and even better, its only a short walk from my house. A long stagger home, tho. Drinks are crazy cheap, and the clientele seem pretty cool. Actually quite entertaining at times, so ticks my whole people-watching box. I will be back many more times.
author: Catriona C.

description: Once when I was here I encountered a dog who loved to play fetch with coasters.  The dog and I both had a great time.
author: Derek D.

description: 500 club is my favorite neighborhood bar. It's really chill, there's an interesting mix of people there, and unless it's a Friday or Saturday night, it's never too busy. Surprisingly, It's also never empty. There seems to be a fair number of people there from when it opens in the morning to when it closes at night. All in all, it's a great place to get a drink.
author: Julia W.

description: There's a playboy pinball machine in a dark corner by the pool table that shows a naked chick after reaching a certain number of points. 'Nuff said...
author: Cathy C.

description:
Recently my best friend was in town from England for exactly 8 hours. I gave him the usual wander around the city then at 2PM we decided a pint was in order. My usual haunt Lucky 13's doesn't open until 4pm: Where to go I thought? I know, the 500 - it opens at 2PM. We were the first folks through the door and the super-amenable bartender bought our first round gave us free reign on the jukebox! My friend was monumentally impressed - even more when he found Roky Erikson on it! For these reasons, I have to LOVE the 500.
To the person who ordered the car-bombs and got ripped off... Only idiots ever order that drink. As a bartender I know. Return to the Marina please!
author: Matt E.

description: I havent been here yet but I cant add it to my list of dog friendly places unless I have a review. Ill edit my star rating and review once I visit the place (this weekend perhaps). Until then 5 stars just for allowing dogs :)
author: Brando Calrissian ..

description:
wow, totally quirky place with quirky characters.  cash only kinda sucks, but cheap and fun and interesting divey, but not boring.  i like.

if you go to Delfina (pizza) and have a wait, this is a great place to wait, but be careful, you might get lost here longer than expected.  lively and interesting.
author: Today Y.

description: Bacon Bloody Mary's! With so many fixins' my V8 comes on the side?! Yes please!
author: R C.

description:
crowded, smelly but i had a great time.  the polaroid photo booth is especially frisky here.

the bartenders. are. awesome.  i'm not even sure how late it was when we finally left. 

i do know this.  it was around 5:30 this morning when i totalled my car.

clearly a five star night.
author: marin m.

description: Ahh yes our local watering hole... gotta love the bars that are right around the corner.. makes it easy.. also helps that they have some killer drinks, and cheap as F*ck.  bartenders seem to remember us everytime we come in, even know there are nights i dont remember leaving.. They let us bring in our deaf kitty and that was a big hit with the crowd so its a gem in my Gf's eye as well..  good drinks, good people.. gotta love it.
author: jamie z.

description: Try to get the booth next to the portrait of a Smokey and the Bandit era Burt Reynolds.  Sometimes people will bribe you to give them the table.  Also, don't play pool here against anyone drinking Shirley Temples.  They want your money.
author: Sam P.

description: This place is it! $3 cocktails and sour cream 'n onion pringles as the bar snack of choice. This the kind of place you go to when you just want a place to sit down and get sh&t faced, and I love it. If I could, I'd live here....funny smells and all.
author: Marie M.

description: I understand the overall deal with Yelp. Many Yelpers are hip, trendy, finger-on-the-pulse, shun-all-that-is-mainstream kinda people. That's fine; if it bugged me I wouldn't be on Yelp. But I reserve the right to state that I'm not so beholden to the Mission as most Yelpers. Don't get me wrong; there are countless cool spots in the neighborhood, and it is the taqueria capital of the city, but I don't see it as the be-all and end-all of our Jewel by the Bay. And so the 500 Club. It's your standard Mission pub / bar, and I'm totally cool with it. It's cozy, has an above-average beer selection, one pool table, etc. But to me it's the epitome of a 3-star review. I wouldn't go out of my way to come here, but once here, I'm cool to stay for the evening. So 3 stars it is.
author: Drew S.

description: i like it... strong women and cool drinks.  does that mean anything? hmmm. i like it though
author: ari b.

description: I like the 500 a lot more on the weekdays, sans hordes of people who have descended upon the mission to live out their dirty weekend in the city. Stiff drinks are always a plus. The jukebox is good, but has become a bit predictable. This is a great bar to get drunk in on a thursday afternoon.
author: Steven C.

description: This place is kind of dumb.  Rockabily?  Who the hell cares about that?  this place has everything that you could want in a dive with a crowd that is so lacking in substance that I can't even hang.
author: Thadd L.

description: The pool table is small, has scratches, and is blocked in places by walls and broken photobooths but this is still my favorite pool table in the mission. I think the bartenders are starting to know me by the fact that i play two gallants every time i walk in to play pool or do the crossword, which may or may not be a couple times a week (it's crawling distance from my front door).
author: Geryon R.

description: Fun laidback bar - cheap and strong drinks. Love it. There are pool tables in a separate room for added fun. You'll see a lot of regulars, so the pretentious crowd won't likely be in here.
author: Stacy T.

description: This place is nice and dark. They were playing a cheesy b-horror movie on television. My jameson was very affordable. I dug the bar... but there is some seedy clientele. Some acne ridden dude tried to start conversation with me while I was pissing. I can never tell if that shit is a clumsy gay pass... some attempt at pointless intimidation, or just a drunk dude being really drunk, and oblivious to the fact that he's talking to a person that's doing something very private. Either way, the 500 club rocks, and I don't know anything like it in LA.
author: Evan K.

description: One of my favorite local bars.  Not a place for a lightweight drinkers - you go here to drink (alot).  If you can score a cozy booth, you may never leave.  The crowd is very Mission with a dash of Rockabilly thrown in.
author: Annabel G.

description:
Lets call this what it is a fun, shit hole of a bar, with great mix of a crowd, great beers in the bottle and on tap. There is plenty of room when this place is crowded you can stand, sit at the bar, sit in the booths and admire all the stuff on the walls. $2 PBR in the bottle for some reason taste a lot better, than when it is $1 in the can. 

Good place to stop by on a night of drinking debauchery.
author: David B.

description: Five stars for being a good dive bar in my neighborhood. Minus 2 stars for  the smell, and walking in on two dudes fucking in the bathroom.  Get a room folks.
author: claude m.

description:
I always have lots of fun here.  The blinking martini glass beckons as you're heading west on 17th toward Guerrero.  

I've come to know some of the regulars at this bars.  A couple of them have been showing up for 15 years or better.  A couple of them are not scared away by the droves of younger drunks on the weekend.

It's a decent place to chat people up.  Good juke box if you're ready to rock.  $2 Pabst, always served super cold.  $3 Shiner.  Lot's of good stuff on tap.  

The bartenders are cool.  I see some of them around at the other bars in the Mission.  I always pick this one bartender's brain about his new favorite metal bands. 

Yep good spot.  One of my favorite places.
author: Daniel K.

description: Like going there to meet up with friends and catching up after 9 or 10 during the week.
author: Trinity M.

description: When I first drove by this bar a few years ago, I thought it was the sketchiest looking bar I'd ever seen.  Maybe it was the lit up sparkling sign, or the fact that it opens at 6 in the morning, but I thought it looked like a run down old man bar. Well, I eventually mustered the strength to go inside, and found that it's still the sketchiest bar ever, but in the best possible way! There is a fun young crowd, nice booths to sit in, and good music always playing. This is my second favorite bar in the city. AND they recently got rid of the puke-smelling carpet and replaced it with hardwood floors. Major score!
author: Jamie J.

description:
nothing really special about this bar. and the fact that its in the mission means that i will go there. because when it gets down to it a bar is a bar is a bar.
thats what this place is to me. just another bar.
author: Morgan G.

description: Sweet bar in the mission that's a total throwback to real gritty small-town bars of the midwest. When I go in there, I could swear that I'm back in Wisconsin except for all the great California beers on tap and a killer jukebox stacked to the gills. Don't let the ZZ Top poster on the back wall or gaudy red leather booths fool you, this is a great bar with an eclectic crowd that look rougher than they really are. The place looks a little dark and ominous, but is a really chill neighborhood bar.
author: Michael E.

description: Totally reminds me of a suburban basement rec room and I love it. Plus there's a photo booth, which makes up for any possible shortcomings.
author: Kyla B.

description: apparently one of the bartenders has been dropping a shit load of money at Self Edge, so that's cool in my book. He also kept giving us free drinks, also cool... This place gets a bit too packed on weekends, I'm sure during the week it's better... -1 for the weird shaved-head black chick who hit on me and scared the shit outta me... wtf... well, I'll prolly still be back to 500 Club, the photobooth is golden...
author: Andrew N.

description: This place is great. They have a good amount of seating for a dive bar and the crowd is chill. 3$ bottles and 4$ drafts is pretty darm cheap too..also good tunes and lots of weird funny stuff on the walls.. cash only..
author: K A.

description: A friendly neighborhood dive bar in the very best sense of the words.
author: Jude F.

description: Go when it's not busy (on a weekend afternoon when the alcoholics and old people are hanging out) and get the best bloody mary ever made by Rachel.
author: Pam D.

description: Jukebox, weird fashionistas trying to get us to buy Budweiser with $1 coupons, and reasonably cheap drinks.
author: Kimberley D.

description:
2 stars for the bar - it smelled and looked like a college bar... sweat and stale beer lingered in the air, the music was too loud and IMO, not very good. it was small and crowded, but we managed to camp out in the corner with a high school desk and some bar stools, so that was nice. but the floor, wall, everything was sticky and one of my friends accidentally leaned on a table littered with broken glass and ended up with a bloody hand. he had to suck the glass pieces out with his mouth... yow. 

3.5 stars for the crowd - nobody was inconsiderate or pushy or grope-y, everybody was chill and just there to hang out with their friends 

3 stars for the drinks and bartenders - drinks weren't more expensive than elsewheres and my vodka and Sprite was definitely a lot more vodka than Sprite. bartenders were nice enough. 

500 club did its job for the night! lots and lots of rounds were bought for my funnyman pal, Silvio!
author: Christine N.

description: As a wise friend once said, every bar in the mission has something gross about it. The gross thing about the 500 club is that it has carpet (ok, enough visualization for the time being). That aside, this is a pretty good place to go for a drink with some friends. Good drink selection, and a nice ambiance - what more could you want?
author: Dana L.

description: I may just be giving it 5 stars because i beat the old dude at pool, BUT I BEAT THE OLD DUDE AT POOL!  oh and the poloroid photo booth was a barrel of monkeys.
author: Moi S.

description:
this place always looked so uncomfortably packed from outside, but surprisingly it wasn't that bad being in there last night with a group of people... maybe we had good timing but we even got a spot to sit comfortably and enjoy our (inexpensive) drinks...
the two bartenders were quick and attentive although there were a lot of people wanting drinks...
remember, cash only... they do have an atm machine inside
author: charlotte s.

description: has moments but now over run by 20 something computer geek types who think they are coolio hipster types. staff is way cool, know their shit. good food sent from the deli next door - claire's kitchen i think. juke box good. place makes bank though, congrats
author: Robert P.

description: Just another Mission dive...nothing special here. Decent beer, attentive bartenders. But the crowd was self-involved and unfriendly. Smelled like...dive bar. It was just another overcrowded, overheated bar in the Mission where some crusty guys were attempting to create enough space to play pool in the back room. I like some dive bars, and in the Mission, there are way too many better options than to go this place.
author: Tolga E.

description:
low pretense, lots of character, cheap drinks.  

I don't know why but I don't think of this as a dive bar.  But it's still a great bar.
author: Josh F.

description: I feel this place is somehow bigger than normal bars in the city. Fine drinks and comfortable seats. I like its usually quiet so you don't have to "yell" at your friends when you talk...Sometime, if you are lucky, you will meet old lady selling hot tamales outside. Yummy...
author: Yina M.

description: Good jukebox, unpretentious crowd, cheap drinks and good times make this my favorite bar in the city.  I only wish that it would open at 6am like its sign says.
author: Michael M.

description: Maybe I've just become a ger-crotchety old woman, but I found this place rather unpleasant.  There were just too many hipsters trying to out-hip each other.
author: Helen C.

description: Perfect vibe. I love the fireplace...adds a lot of class to the joint.
author: Whit P.

description:
i just have to say right out of the review gate... i am sort of not the type that attends 500 club. but, I LOVE IT. if you stay for a long time you can hear some jams on the jukebox and have great banter with the bartenders and door people. OH, the bartender with the full sleeves... what a dreamboat! 
drinks are just the way i like them, strong and cheap. this bar is totally no nonsense in all respects.
author: alexis g.

description:
i think i subconsciously avoided this place for 3 years because of that (really cool, now that i think about it) 50's neon sign out front. i guess i assumed it was an old man bar or something. actually, there was one old dude at the bar with a big white santa beard, which made the place all the more rad.

the red carpets and fireplace and christmas lights make you feel like you're in your quirky uncle's living room. and he's a lush.
author: jean w.

description: About as close as you get to a good midwestern dive bar. Great booths for socializing.
author: SF U.

description: A little bit of scenester place with people trying to outdo each other with how little they care about life.  It's for people who want to be Charles Bukowski, but who are afraid of dive bars.
author: Tim G.

description: This used to be my favorite bar in SF and is still a great spot.  Had some friends who lived around the corner and spent many hours here, playing on the little pool table in the back.  Great place for a drink.  Good tunes.  Good bartenders.  Nice, comfy booths.  It can get pretty packed on the weekends, but there's usually an ebb and flow of people.  My only complaint is they got rid of the pool table.  Was always a good diversion and I tend to pick other places instead now.
author: Zach J.

description:
super chill place, a little loud, no creeps, friendly bartender.

drinks were super cheap! $10 for a martini & chambord/sprite combo.
author: Aiko L.

description: I thought this place was pretty great, despite the fact that they don't take credit cards and the floor is carpeted.  Great vibe, good atmosphere, nice fireplace and booths.
author: Joanna S.

description:
good beer on tap
playboy pinball machine
polaroid photo booth
swingin jukebox
pool tables

update: i f-ing love this place.
author: Sophie S.

description: One of my favorite dive bars.  Sure the carpets smell like stale beer and old vomit but the drinks are always strong and the bartenders are nice.  It gets too crowded with annoying people on the weekend though (like all Mission bars).
author: Maria M.

description: I love this place.  Very comfortable dive.  Good drinks, good atmosphere, good bartenders, good jukebox. . . one of the few bars I've found in San Francisco that feels like my old Chicago hang-outs.
author: Katie P.

description: The old stand by. Nothing ever changes here. The drinks remain strong and cheap at Happy Hour. Good stuff.
author: Adrienne G.

description: Think uncle Bob's mid west basement rec room.  With good music.
author: Lauren M.

description: What used to be an "old timers" hangout is now the gentrified watering hole for mostly 20+ hipsters. Conveniently located in my neighborhood and equipped with booths, it's a nice venue to entertain friends.
author: Miles G.

description: This place won Best Dive Bar because it had all the element of a dive bar including a pool table.  It was a fixture.  Apparently it sparked some disagreements so it was removed, but it's time to move on and bring it back.  Please.  I'm not coming back til the pool table comes back.
author: Jen M.

description: Yes, its a dive bar (Marinian's beware). So if that's what your into, try and find a stronger drink in the City.... And if you do, let me know.
author: Joseph M.

description: A neighborhood favorite!  I've always had a great time and it's hard to find pool tables in this city so I can kick major ass with my skills.  Nothing like a good dive.
author: Natalie E.

description: Went here for my birthday for the first time.  I have always been scared of it, because someone told me that people get shot in here all the time.  My friends cracked up at this statement, and after I went in I really felt silly.  It is a hipster bar with a pool table that is impossible to play with the crowd, but a nice big bar to belly up to and get a drink.
author: Pele N.

description: This is a cool dive bar. They're all about sparks and miller. Its cool place and they have pool but forget playing it. This place is so packed all the time
author: Mike L.

description: From what I hear all the cocaine stories are true.  I'm pretty sure the pool table is slightly un-level.  Tecate: correct.  You can bring your dog.
author: Kasey K.

description:
This place is pretty awesome. Nice, affordable drinks and bartenders who are cranky in that kind of cool way that makes you feel stupid for ordering a drink.  I think the jukebox here is just divine. I once saw Nicolas Cage here (in a Nicolas cage voice: "Hi, I'm Nic Cage". He didn't say that by the way) with some strange looking woman and I did that thing where you nod at someone and they nod back at you and then you tell people for the next 20 years of your life how you had this long talk with Nicolas Cage at this bar in the Mission. So, y'know..you can now get an idea of where I'm coming from in terms of my self-esteem. Anyway, this is a nice place to grab a night cap and on the weekdays it's quiet enough for you to stretch out in the booth that has a picture of Burt Reynolds hanging over it because that is what hipsters find ironic and funny. Hardy-har-har your truck driver hat wearing muther effers. 
NOTE:
There is a lot of conflicting thoughts in this review I know. Let me sum it up: this is a cool bar to go to, please don't let the hip ruin it for you. Invite me and we'll dominate the cool jukebox and in numbers, we can show them all that it's hip to be square.
author: Benji T.

description: Excellent jukebox, and a decent gin & tonic.  But they had me at "fireplace."
author: Jennif E.

description: On of my favorites, sure it gets crowded, but I always enjoy an evening at the 500 with friends.  Plus, how can you not like a place with the the best of Duran Duran CD for you to play.  A nice, enjoyable semi-dive bar.
author: Alured P.

description: I'm not the high-fiving type, let that be known. But, you can't help but to slap some skin at this place. But, if you're more self-aware than I am (and I really shouldn't be high-fiving ANYONE), then you can resort to a silent fist pump....it's OK. First off, the jukebox is the raddest jukebox EVER. And even better, most of the time the barkeep will spot you some coin for some tunes. Another thing, whoever makes the beer selections over there at that bar is the ichiban, because they got Magner's, and it's not even an Irish bar! Who cares about the carpet, or the paneling, or the tired booths. This place is legit. If bars were people, this is that aging rockstar that can kick any of these new "rocker" kids asses. Picture Nikki Sixx vs. Linkin Park (the entire band).
author: M S.

description: I used to think this place was cool.  The only time it is relatively entertaining, it is so packed you can't move.  Oh yeah, and the bitchy baretender who works there a lot on Sundays will talk even more shit if you don't tip her.  She is part of the reason I quit going here.  At least the drinks should be cheap, but this place can't even pull that off.  Too bad, it has potential.  But the beautiful thing about San Francisco is that if you don't like one place, just go down the block for another.  :)
author: Brandon C.

description: When I think dive, I think 500 Club. And I'm not really a dive bar kinda girl, there's just something about this place. Despite its griminess, its worn carpeting, its expired mixers, I just like it. Maybe it's the eclectic patrons and juke box? Maybe it's the cheap drinks and convenient location? Maybe it's the flashing neon martini glass? I'm not really sure.
author: Lorin M.

description: If you like dive bar's look no further, this place is the king. Random is what comes to mind when I think of the 500 Club, it's the kind of place where anything can happen....and something always happens. I love this place, great crowd, kickin' jukebox, good beer and carpet on the floor....come on what more could you ask for?
author: sean l.

description: Good jukebox, cheap Tecates, fast pool table.
author: lawrence c.

description: This is just a fun-style dive bar, where it seems like it's okay to do anything you want, as long as it's clear you're drunk enough. Cool.
author: Shannon R.

description:
Whenever I introduce a person to this bar, they always come back.

Random aside: the last two times I was there, the movie Roadhouse was playing on tv.
author: Greg S.

description: Went here last night while bar hoppin with the chicas. This place rocks! The bouncers are super friendly and the crowd is mostly mixed and has an overall good vibe.
author: Kay Kay L.

description: A dive indeed with a pool table and a funky juke box, Five Hundo gets the evening started right.
author: Marty S.

description: Not to bad!!  I went there a few weeks ago.. and been MANY times awhile back It is a awsome "dive bar"  Good times and good people! Can get packed too!
author: Rich C.

description: Shiner on tap. $2 PBR Bottles. Pool Table. Easy to get drinks on weeknights. Nicer booths than the Uptown. Great Jutebox. Pretty, pretty good.
author: West S.

description: walked in and ordered 3 drinks, total came out to $6 bucks. dayum! photobooth was fun although extremely crowded. props for the arcade that featured frogger(i kept picturing costanza walking through traffic), donkey kong, ms. pac man, etc. this place was animal friendly too. there was a little rat that i was playing with all night and he was even walking on the bar. more props for making the drinks extra strong and having pbr in bottle-form. minus 1 star for kicking out cute/passed out girl. cock-blockers...
author: Andrew T.

description: this is a tried, tired and true bar on teh mission booze trail.  it is just a great bar.  no one is annoying and they have adult beverages. that is it.
author: e c.

description: Is it just me, or is 16th St getting a little sketchier and crazier every time I try to go on a pub crawl here?  This last time we actually wound up retreating to the (by comparison) downright wholesome scene along 22nd, but not before making a brief stop at the 500 Club.  First things first: love that Vegas-esque sign.  But don't be expecting a retro-lounge thing inside--instead, it's a happy and happening dive bar filled with a unique mix of earnest dive-lovers and hipsters.  It certainly makes for an interesting jukebox playlist, which jumps and jerks from so-ironic-it's-not to so-unironic-it-is fast enough to make your head spin.  Or maybe that's from the $3 Hinano--canned beer from Tahiti that pretty much got a universal thumbs-down from our group (so much for it being the new PBR).  Anyway, the important thing is that, whatever scary shouting matches may be transpiring down the block, you'll find at the 'Hundy a harmonious haven for any shade of Lush.
author: Wes M.

description: From the outside, this looks like a bar local elders would go to but I come to find out that wasn't the case. It's another typical hipster bar in the mission. The decor kind of reminds me of Doc's Clock. Seating doesn't seem to be a problem here and they have a couple forms of entertainment! Which we all know is always a plus when you drink. There are TVs, a juke box (I think) and karaoke. I should warn you that some people can leave you with a ring in your ears for quite some time. The bartenders are pretty chill.  The prices for drinks are average and... Because the bar isn't very big, they usually have at least two bartenders on duty. I'd say that's enough to attend to everyone. It doesn't get ridiculously crowded, even on weekends, so the wait for drinks is pretty short. So with all that being said, I would recommend giving this place a try. Its an awesome bar to go to when you want to keep things low-key.
author: Rosa L.

description: I'm the kind of drinker who knows better than to start out with wine at dinner, move on to a couple of vodka cocktails and then finish with a bar crawl of tequila shots and beer - nowadays that is.  Those old hangovers were brutal punishment for not calling my drink at the start of the night and sticking to it!  So where do you go after a terrific Mexican meal to keep drinking margaritas?  If it's Sunday afternoon, and you've shared a pitcher or two in the mission, go see Bree at the 500 Club.  She's cute as heck, but not too sweet, like her Margs, and that's why I dig 'em both.  FRESH lime is the penultimate ingredient in a real, made-to-order margarita - not some syrupy, anti-freeze goo.  Plus, she has the perfect sassy bartender touch.  I've never had a better margarita from a non-latin-food bar.  Other great touches - the jukebox and photo booth, the number of cute, shy boys (whom I was too shy to talk to) and the insanely nice guy grilling hot-dogs (he offered me a veggie burger but i was full of burrito).  I hear this place gets obnoxious when it's loaded with Bridge and Tunnel folks, but it's always been un-packed, friendly and delicious to me.  Saturday nights are for amatuers anyway - who start with wine, then have a couple of vodka...
author: Michelina M.

description:
bashing this place does not seem fair from a guy like me. i hung here back in the day when my buddies and i were the hippsters of our day running around the mission when it wernt not so poplular or clean or safe but it was a blast.
so i shant blast this place. its just as cool as it used to be just a diff crowd still choppin it up and having a good time. an old stomping ground buddy and i went here to relive our glory days. well being a decade older than most of the 21 year olds didnt bother us. it didnt bother us either to enjoy the company of the three very nice young ladies who gave us the time of day and some fun conversation.
we walked out a bit tipsy and still evey so in love with this killer city.

hey what happend to the 6am open for drinking policy? too bad?
author: Jeff K.

description: dive bar. photo booth. dude with long beard always here playing pool. $2.50 tecates in cans. what's not to love?
author: Angi C.

description: one of the best dive bars in the mission.  decent price drinks, good ambience, they have a fire place.  excellent to go for happy hour, or even on a night out.
author: Dishar R.

description: thank you 500 club for making me feel at home while i was on vacation. drinks were cheap and strong. jukebox was awesome! there were just enough people there for a saturday night, not too crowded. we sat in the corner next to a pin the tail on the donkey, and we did. well at least tried to. probably not the best game in a bar. blindfolding a drunk person, then spinning them around, and giving them a sharp object? haha fun nonetheless.
author: phoebe r.

description: Most of the people here are part of some underground culture I don't know about.  But come here with friends and it's a great place to hang out.  It's a beer kind of place though.  BTW - don't sit at the second table - that's where all the smoke wafts in from the outside and collects.
author: gen w.

description: i love this place but wish it were less crowded.  as my buddy said, "why does it feel like everyone here is trying too hard?"
author: James R.

description: i've always been curious about this place, and i finally ventured in last night. they have carpet! i kind of like it. they have white russians, and any bar that has white russians is okay in my book. they were playing some really good classic rock last night. i was drunk enough to appreciate it, and i even kicked out some fantastic air drumming solos. MORE RIDE CYMBAL! i quit when people started to stare. ahemmm...will be back when it's less crowded (if that's at all possible).
author: Oleya P.

description: this place is ok once in a while. they've got a decent jukebox and they've got a pool table - which is always being used. i don't go out of my way to go here, but it's ok once in a while when you're sick of all the other bars in the area.
author: James J.

description: this place smells HORRID. i live half a block away so sure, I go every once in a while. but the smell that emanates from it like a hellpit never really entices me to breathe deep. or breathe at all. it gets so full in there that you can barely fight your way through the hipsters. but the jukebox is pretty good, and the drinks are strong and cheap.
author: Lisa Marie G.

description: i know it's a favorite, buy how can people even stand in there when it smells of vomit?
author: regina k.

description: this place was my neighborhood drinking hole, then i moved, but i still love to go back. that's a good sign for a dive bar. a fantastic juke box and pbr on tap--my two requirements for a proper swillin' spot. (who am i kiddin'? i don't need the juke box.)
author: Dean E.

description: cheap, stiff drinks...great neighborhood hang out...my dog loves it
author: Teresa H.

description: If you want strong drinks, a very strong jukebox, and a strong dose of hipsters, then the 500 club is your spot. this place is a great spot on a school night when it isn't as crowded. good bartenders so be nice to them.
author: Stephen D.

description: dig the booths - they didnt have the capability of making irish car bombs... yes, it was one of those days. cool place - it didnt smell like vomit and i will go back.
author: Tre S.
